description: The staff here is amazing! Usually one person working when my team is there for lunch, but I feel like we're never forgotten. All the food is excellent and there are plenty of options to choose from. They also have HP sauce which is rare in any bar!
author: Kory L.

description:
This Irish neighborhood bar is such a riot! With its cast of charismatic, colorful & off-colored loyal clientele of mostly SF natives and locals, it could become one of those iconic hang out spots like the Central Perk Café, Cheers Bar, Clary's Café, or Monk's Café! I have literally, on MORE THAN ONE occasion, during broad DAYLIGHT and amongst SOBER people, witnessed a patient coming in for breakfast on a Sunday morning after JUST being released from the ER for having a crazy, drunken Saturday night; an entire bar play musical chairs with no music; people forming alliances with strangers to play pranks on others within minutes of meeting each other; and not 1, not 2, but 3 separate people putting on a mask that they randomly happened to have with them, NOT during Halloween. Again, during broad daylight and while sober!

Ok, now about the food/drinks:
I don't know anything about beer, but they've got a LOT of it. Just remember, "When in doubt... grab a STOUT!" Guinness, of course!! 

On cold, rainy days, the Shepard's Pie or the  Guinness Beef Stew hits the spot with tender, juicy meat, rich gravy, and fluffy mashed potatoes. 
Save room for dessert! Get that bread pudding!
author: Mitzi G.

description:
I came here the night before st patricks day to beat the wild crowd. Im half irish and have been wanting to try it out. I ordered the Guinness beef stew, onion rings, a glass of guiness, and a magners irish hard cider.

It was still crowded prior to st patricks day in an hour but the awesome waitress ran around and took care of the whole place with ease. She had a heavy irish accent but gave good recomendations and was very personable. 

My Guinness stew was filling and very hearty. Lots of chunks of beef and veggies with the gravy and mashed potatoes. It was all tender and cooked just right. After drinking for a while I got hungry again and decided to go non authentic having met my half irish st patricks quota and got the onion rings. Oh man these were great. Meaty slices of onion and a crispy golden batter.

They took the time to tell me how much they would love me back and let me know of some good upcoming events and im definitely going to take them up on it.
author: Sean G.

description: Love this place!  Great neighborhood bar where they really know your name!  The place is filled with locals and they have some of the friendliest bartenders around.  Be sure to come for brunch,lunch, dinner, and late night bites.  The kitchen makes amazing food!  A lot of the food tastes homemade.  I'm a huge fan!
author: Lan T.

description:
This places is awesome.  A legit Irish bar to the core.  Good food, great drinks,  awesome & friendly staff, and they play everything.
We watched the NBA playoffs(OKC,POR, HOU, UT,) UFC Fight Night Prelim and Main card(Miller,Sterling,Frankie Edgar, Cub, Simon, Santos, Branch, Lee Vs Barbosa) , Showtime boxing( Broner, Charlo, Davis) .

Love this bar in the mission.
author: Steven L.

description:
3.5 STARS

A friend lives in the area, so the three of us went to The Napper Tandy and met up his girlfriend. We got here on Friday, May 19th around 9:15pm. We managed to grab a table by the water station along the wall. Our table was roomy enough for another friend to join us later.

*Bacon Cheddar Fries Basket
*Chicken Wings: spicy buffalo or bbq
*Crispy Potato Skins: potato skins topped with melted cheese and bacon served with sour cream
*Beer Battered Onion Rings: served with ranch

I didn't take a picture of the menu, but we got the items mentioned above. A combo platter made up the chicken wings, potato skins, and onions rings while the bacon cheddar fries were their own dish. I didn't try any of the food, but it looked like your standard fried bar food to soak up the alcohol. I got a Jameson on the rocks and one of my friends got some sort of flavored vodka. Maybe an absolut citron?

Fun, kinda divey bar. Our server was great and I had a good time. Not sure if they still do Trivia Nights, but I wouldn't mind coming back to check that out. Or just dropping by to catch a game while throwing back some drinks and snacks.
author: Elena N.

description: This place was okay, very crowded and not enough stools when they have a bar table up against the wall. No ventilation so stuffy. The food is good i must say and you get your drinks fast. Only been twice and would go again for the food i just got to stand and eat becauae they don't have enough seats
author: Mona L.

description:
I've only been here for brunch, but I would come back here any hour of the day if I could get that wonderful eggs Benedict again. The atmosphere was really friendly and every seemed to be having a good time, regardless of whether people were sitting at the bar drinking and watching the game or like myself and just trying to squeeze in a great brunch with a friend. It was dive-y enough to make you feel relaxed and comfortable, without being too grimy or seedy.

The food itself was out of this world, especially for a bar. I have to admit my standards were quite low, but once I took one look at my meal I knew I would be enjoying every bite. My friend and I both got the Louisiana Benedict, and we still talk about to this day. The avocado was perfectly ripe, and the eggs a dream atop the sausage and English muffin. This will be the standard I hold the rest of my eggs Benedict to the rest of my life.
author: Jenny D.

description:
My favorite neighborhood bar. 
It's hard to describe what I love so much about this place - it's one of those places you just gotta go to understand. 

The food is hot and delicious. We order the hot wings, the tots, and a few beers and it's heaven! The staff is great and laid back. Love the vibe here. 
Screens for all your favorite shows. Friendly folks all around. 
No Cons.
author: Nini H.

description: Came here years ago when I still hung out with my coworkers. It was funny back then when Ramon left a 21 year old friend thinking he was abandoned.
author: M C.

description: Not a bad place, but please CLEAN YOUR TAPS! The draft beer here tastes rancid. Friendly crowd though, and (occasionally) friendly bartenders.
author: Danny B.

description:
The best bar food you could ask for, fresh beers on tap, and the nicest waitresses in the city. What more could you ask for? This is my favorite place. 

Pro tip, get the tater tot nachos with bacon bits. Trust me.
author: Todd F.

description:
Alas Nappy Tandy, it shall never be. You had such potential but San Francisco beat me down, chewed me up and spit out my spent body and soul.

You would have been my dive bar of choice new dive bars. 

Few melenials and the dirty Irish folk that that both frequent the bar and work there were a complete joy to be around and all of you have the loveliest accents...

I think I met my first semi-reformed soccer hooligan there... 

I would have stayed but my car was stolen on a Sunday and I got fired from a semi-shitty tech company the next Monday... A bunch of other sh¡the went down as well... 

I wish you all the best and you earned all five of your stars.

My home town of San Diego, she beckons me back to her warm, soft and inviting busom...
author: Steven T.

description: Stopped in on my vacation in San Francisco because we desperately wanted pub food after the Sharks game. The food there is AMAZING and I never would have expected it. It looks like an Irish pub/sports bar mashup and the bartenders are super friendly ladies with quick service and awesome personality. Drinks are a little light-poured, and the specials were just premade cocktails in a pitcher that were a bit too sweet for me. But I would come back here any day for the mac and cheese, bangers and mash, and any other thing on that menu. I hate that I am so far away back in Seattle...
author: Hannah D.

description: Best dive bar in the Mission. They know how to pour a Guinness. Great place to watch a game. And their food isn't just really great pub food, they have a hearty brunch and an excellent spicy Bloody Mary. And lastly, it's the best name for a pub in the entire damn town. That alone makes this place extra special and worth a visit.
author: David A R.

description: Just popped in for a couple of beers while on a business trip. Two fastest friendliest bartenders I've ever had in San Francisco. Day before St. Patrick's Day and this Irish pub was getting geared up while keeping everyone taken care of. Good Luck tomorrow, ladies!
author: Stephen L.

description:
Ordered delivery through Uber eats and was very impressed with the quality of the food! We had onion soup, Cesar salad, wings and onion rings. The wings were really good size with lots of meat! The sauce wasn't really spicy but it was tasty. The Cesar salad was delicious! The dressing was great and the lettuce was clearly fresh and crisp. The onion soup was also very good. It had more onions than soup, which I personally like. The app didn't have an option for a side of onion rings so I added in the notes section of the order. The onion rings were light and crispy and the ranch dipping sauce was the best! 

Overall you can tell the food is freshly made and it seems as if all of the dressing is made in house. We will definitely be ordering from here again!
author: Mallory B.

description:
I set up a brunch with some Eng friends and I on a random Saturday morning. It wasn't packed at all and service brought their A game. I've been here at night before too, and it's a whole different story (which of course is understandable, it's a great bar that's always packed!). 

I like that they have TV's, ample seating, lots of standing room, and it's intimate enough to have a conversation without going deaf. 

Everything I had at brunch was extremely salty, so I wouldn't recommend the food. 

Love the energy of this bar, so great!
author: Shereen A.

description: This is a great bar.  Not much Irish in this Irish Pub, except that they serve Guinness and a shepherd's pie, but no matter.  The bar area is cramped and small, so be prepared to meet people.  A generous serving of TVs.  Lot's and lots of beer selection, from local crafts, to mexican and american favorites.  Lot's of booze to choose from also; I feel for the bartenders having to navigate around all that stuff in a small space.  Wings are excellent - I don't normally like breaded wings, but the sauce was just the right amount of HOT that I was converted.  Burgers are awesome and the parmesan garlic fries were outstanding.  Happy Hour specials.  A great lil bar that makes me wish I lived nearby...
author: Ken P.

description:
Great place to watch any sporting event with friends (though you may want to carpool...parking sucks around this area).  They have multiple TVs and even a large projector (although billiard players may be in the way).   Our fairly large group was able to get table(s) when arriving around 430 on a Friday.  
Their food is good, nothing to write home about.  We ordered the fried calamari (for some reason, it wasn't on the menu), wings (buffalo and teriyaki), garlic fries, fish and chips, and shepherds pie.  The fried calamari, while not on the menu, was good. Other places that I order fried calamari includes a marinara type sauce which I think would make this dish better.  Wings were very good (but it's hard to screw up wings).  The entrees we ordered (fish and chips and shepherds pie) were alright.  The fish and chips were on the soggy side, but still was good.  The shepherds pie tasted like shepherds pie and was very heavy on the gravy taste (which isnt necessarily a bad thing).  the garlic fries were cheesy and garlicy....best of all THEY HAVE PORTLAND KETCHUP (by far the best ketchup i've ever tasted).
Our order also had many pitchers. Service was great and servers were attentive in cleaning away dishes and glasses and reordering food.

TL:DR: great place to watch sporting events. Beer is in abundance and food is good.  USE PORTLAND KETCHUP!
author: Alex J.

description: Great service, food and beverages. Had the fish & chips and an old fashioned with Bulleit whiskey
author: Jason M.

description: Been wanting to eat here for awhile and today finally did today.OMG!!! From walking in the front door to leaving, out of a 10,it was a 20 ! We were greeted by Lisa immediately, seated, given menus, ordered drinks, looked at menus(plentiful options),got water and drinks, all within 10 minutes. Ordered the Big Blue.  AMAZING!! My partner ordered the corned beef and cabbage. YUMMMY!!!!throughout, Lisa checked on us at least five times although she had an almost full bar! Great food, drinks . Run to this bar, don't walk!!!!!
author: Gary R.

description: Nice neighborhood bar.  Friendly atmosphere with real Irish bartenders!   Guinness was on point for sure!  Leonie is a gem!  Mission district must do.
author: Chris W.

description: Love this place, especially for their Benedict selection and the best breakfast potatoes. Friendly staff, delicious food, strong drinks, reasonable prices and a good neighborhood energy. If you miss brunch service on weekends (they switch to lunch at 1:00pm), you can pivot to a solid burger and what I am pretty sure are the best onion rings in the city. On the healthier side, they serve excellent salads - the arugula salad is a standout - but at its core, this is an Irish pub so you are probably not coming for your health.
author: Julie L.

description:
Went here for the UFC fights last night. The place is pretty spacious, but it was a Mcgregor fight, we were at an Irish pub and it was extremely busy.
 The staff was beyond AMAZING. Despite people being packed like sardines, blocking the POS systems, and just generally in the way, the staff remained patient, fast, and friendly all night. The bouncer is also hilarious- the boyfriend and I actually hung out with him for bits of the night.

The fish and chips were good and you get a great portion for the price. Over all a great spot, we've already made plans to go back next weekend.
author: Katie B.

description: Was here on 6/17/17. The service at this time sucks. Other times it was good. Need a new crew this afternoon crew needs to go back to school.
author: Ricardo H.

description: Brunch is super yummy, lots of tvs, great for watching games with friends, drinks are good, staff is friendly.
author: Giovanie R.

description: This place has the most amazing food and best bartenders! Ask for the French dip.. it's not on the menu but, they can make it for you. Arugula salad also awesome.. the wings are the best I've had anywhere.
author: William J.

description:
I had breakfast here with my sister the other day while I was visiting San Francisco. It was on the early side (9:30-ish on a Saturday) and we were the only people in the place when we walked in. (More people showed up later.)

We had a very attentive server, and the food was really good. I had a veggie flatbread for breakfast. I think it had beans, mushrooms, and an egg on top. Originally I was skeptical of the idea of a pizza with beans on it, but it was super delicious. My only complaint is that it was a bit challenging to eat it off of the cute carving board they served it on without getting food falling everywhere. That might have just been a problem I had, though :) 

My sister had the traditional Irish breakfast, and it was a ton of food. 

Overall, this was a relatively quick and definitely delicious place to grab some food in the morning. The ambiance is "bar."
author: Becca S.

description:
Who who a thunk, an Irish Breakfast at  6 pm? It worked well , everything was great from the bangers to the puddings. It was hearty filling and priced right.
 Only issue is the multiple waiters/waitresses that can add confusion to ordering , getting fed and then paying bill.
  Will be back !
author: Craig S.

description:
Loads of beers on tap, including local, domestic, and imported suds? Check.
An actual Irish bartender or two? Check and check.
Drunk man who stumbles in at 5pm raving about St. Patty's Day? Check.
Multiple screens showing the xGames, World Cup, and AMA Pro Racing? Check.
Guinness soup, burgers, and fish and chips on the menu? Check.
Full bar? Check.

+A solid bar with about 15 bar seats and plenty of table seating nearby. 
+I spotted one bathroom for the ladies and one for the gents (no stalls).
+Ten bucks for two pints. Not bad at all.
+After a pint or three, the burger's amazing (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-napper-tandy-san-francisco?select=d7tPVcBM2fy1m4lmzdDPfQ#Vf9enEeD7ibehshDa9Uteg). Wonder if it's just as good pre-brews. Guess I'll have to go back and see.
author: Adena B.

description:
Wow, this was a great brunch spot!  The food and service were both top notch.

My husband's traditional Irish breakfast was quite good - the sausage, black and white pudding (actually meat patties, not pudding in the American sense of the word), and Irish bacon (very different from American bacon, not really smoky) were all delicious!  The home fries were also cooked just right. My husband's only complaint was that the poached eggs were not runny, as he'd expected them to be.

I enjoyed my garden omelette (it was very generously sized and I could only eat half).

The coffee was nice and strong and we enjoyed the complimentary Irish soda bread they brought us to munch on as we waited for our meals.

The service was great - our waitress was very friendly, attentive, and made sure our coffee cups stayed full.

This was a nice brunch find!
author: Barnali D.

description:
Trivia night is fun, we had about 12 teams going.  The woman who moderates the game has a strong Irish accent and makes it all the more enjoyable to listen to and play.  

We got $3 blue moon on tap all night!  Amazing. Good vibe, good peeps.
author: Angela K.

description: Cute Irish bartenders. Mixed, interesting local clientele. Sports on the big screens. Good spot.
author: Patrick S.

description:
1 Pool Table, some great rotating specials ($3 blue moons, $1.5 Smithwicks, $6.25 Keep Your Cup Guiness), and they have trivia nights Wednesday starting at 8:30pm. Arrive early to grab a table for your group, and be prepared for a couple hour event - there were 6 rounds of somewhat slow-paced trivia questions! The vibe is cool, and the service was friendly and... Irish!

As for food, the burger was ok, the fries were too crispy and garlic-y for my taste, but my favorite was the Guiness Beef Stew and I would def come back for that.
author: Jess C.

description:
Watched the UFC fight at this bar for $10 cover. It's a pretty large space with a big screen in the back and smaller TVs throughout. Make sure to get there early since the bar filled up quickly. The service here is really attentive and friendly.

They have a full menu of burgers, pizza, Irish food, etc. I got the black and blue flatbread (~$8) which had steak and blue cheese with balsamic on it. It was pretty good but I think the blue cheese was a bit overwhelming. We got mozzarella sticks and parmesan fries for the table. Both were super good!

Overall great bar to watch a game!
author: Linda X.

description:
Quick Review: I came here to watch the Warrior playoff game against the Rockets on a Thursday night.  I would never have thought there would be an Irish pub in the Mission but low and behold there is.  This is a pretty low key place with a more mature crowd.  If you are looking for a rowdy crowd you won't find that here but there were still people being vocal and cheering on the home team.  Huge bonus - they gave out free coronas at one point!  

FOOD
Tater Tots - I wasn't super hungry so this was the perfect snack.  Super crunchy and it came with 3 different sauces (garlic aoli, ketchup and ranch).  

SERVICE 
Our server was very busy, she handled the whole back areas (about 6 different groups).  However she did her best to check in with us periodically and took down all of our orders correctly.
author: Brittany S.

description:
Stella pint: tasted old, not nearly cold enough to mask the flaws. 

Glass of water: free. 

Glass of soda water: $3.  

Good luck, guys - hope things get better.
author: Chris C.

description:
And here's your 5th star review from your pal Crys, Naps. My friend and I hunkered down for last night's Giant's win against the Pirates, front and center. They have a great viewing area in the back of the bar where they fill in the normal pool table area with small tables to accomodate more people. 

We ordered drinks with the super awesome waitress, can't remember her name but she was shorter and Filipino and just great. I love it when waitresses use their personality rather than their "brains" to get tips, it's refreshing and I don't feel shame for also being a woman.

For our appetizers we had the Garlic Parmesan Fries ($4.95) which was lots of parm, garlic, and potatoey goodness. We also had, and I kid you not, some of the best Spicy Buffalo Wings ($5 for 5) I've had in a while. They were very hot tempurature-wise, and slightly spicy with a really solid *crunch*. I had to stop myself from eating the whole plate before my friend got to taste their glory. Normally they're $6.95 for 5 but at happy hour it's $5 for a basket of 5, so we got two orders. Seriously good stuff, and on Monday's they're only 50 cents each!

Great vibes all around especially during a Giant's win, and trivia right after. We didn't stay for trivia but I've gone before and it was super fun.
author: Crystal C.

description:
The food and drinks are absolutely amazing.  The staff are really great, and have treated us well regardless of whether they're busy or slow or we're at a table or seated at the bar.

The only down-side (for me) is that it's also a sports bar.  I don't mind that games are always on the screen, but when a big game is happening the place is pretty inhospitable to people who aren't fans of whoever's playing.  Sure, if you're a sports fan that is a big plus, but for those of us who aren't it means the place is kind of a hit or miss.

I will keep coming back, because when it's a hit it's a very very big hit for me.
author: Trilo B.

description:
Friendly service. Typical barfare. Moderate pricing. 

No love letters here, or hate mail, for that matter: it's like the Goldilocks of pubs.
author: Janice P.

description:
After having the app on my iPhone for almost a year, I finally made my first Groupon purchase. It was to this Irish Pub. I love a good pub and this one did not disappoint. Mind you it is an American style pub, so none of the great woodwork, low lighting and bench seats you normally find in Dublin.

There were t.v.'s throughout, showing various sports, a pool table and faux fireplace. The ladies bathroom was spotless and had plants inside. Apparently they just had a recent remodel. 

We had an appetizer of Calamari with Aoili sauce. A+
I ordered the Fish & chips. B+
My fella ordered the Shepherds Pie. A-
The Soda bread was dense and fluffy and the butter was soft. Soft butter is a must when you serve any sort of bread. Bonus points NT!

The info you have all been waiting on; the Guinness was creamy and delicious. Probably some of the best I have had in the Bay area by far. A++  Of course nothing beats a pint in Dublin (Ireland that is.) 

Hmm, I wonder if they will play the world series. Dodgers are doing fantastic!
Suppose I'll have to make another few visits to confirm.
author: Jaylena P.

description:
Great service and staff! 
I enjoy the ambiance in this place. Its interesting to me. 
We came here for happy hour and the prices were decent at that time. 
The staff was really friendly and really helpful with our questions. 
I would recommend to drop by this place :)
Pros: Staff
Cons: Layout of the place
Stars: 3.75
author: Sunny L.

description: Cool little place with a nice bar, pool table in back, and a few tables. Their portions are large and good price!
author: Danielle K.

description:
My friend lives near 24th/Mission, and he mentioned he likes this place to have a drink during the NFL season.  Asked him about the food, and he mentioned he never tried the food.  Always on the search for a place with good fish n chips, we decided to step in for lunch.  The bar is clean, looks like a typical English style pub with lots of scotch, whiskey, and bottles of spirits in a dark divey cave like style.  The bar has a hallway, with a back room area with a pool table.  Plenty of room, never would have guessed how spacious it is after walking by this place for years.
During lunch, they have a select number of appetizers, and one of their flat bread pizzas at a discounted price.  This caught my attention, so I was distracted enough to not order the fish n chips.  I ordered the wings, and steak and blue cheese flat bread pizza.  My friend ordered a huge burger with an egg on top.  Meanwhile waiting for our food, we shot a game of pool.  The vibe of this place is cool, and we had a good time watching pre-season football and rugby while playing pool.
The food was solid, the pizza has a good balsamic glaze with arugula.  The wings were good, not too spicy and plenty of crunchy veggies to help the cause.  My friend seemed to enjoy his huge burger with an egg on top.  I will come back during the NFL season to grab those fish n chips.  Service was nice, and our server/bartender lady also mentioned that Monday nights are all you can eat fish n chips.
I think this place is worth a visit, its an authentic Irish bar, and the people are nice.
author: Marlon T.

description: love love love this place! Great food for Great Prices... they people from the neighborhood are nice plus the staff! Love their Corn Beef Sliders yumy yum nom nom nom
author: FoodieBy T.

description:
$4 beers during happy hour.
$12.99 bottomless fish & chips on Monday.
A pool table in the back. 
Lots of booth seating. 
Big TVs.

It was a good time for our group of about 15-20 people. We put some tables together and talked to each other. It wasn't busy on a Monday afternoon so we were able to sit anywhere and take up a big portion of the seating in the back. We even got to play some pool :) this was definitely a chill place and good for groups! 

I would definitely come back around.
author: Connie Y.

description: Love this place! It can get a bit crowded on popular game nights, so if you're trying to get dinner, come early. It has a sports bar-type feel in the front and a restaurant with tvs and a pool table in the black. Food is delicious, in the average price range for SF restaurants, and the staff is very friendly. This was my go-to bar when I lived in mission.
author: Kaitlin J.

description:
I love watching UFC, and Napper Tandy always has it on for a $10 fee.  The staff here are very friendly and solicitous in making sure you have a good experience. They all seem to have an Irish accent too!  Love it!  

The food here is typical pub food with some Irish goodness.  My bf and I love that Shepard's Pie.  We also had the Caesar salad which came in a large generous portion.  

The establishment itself has some good humored signs on the wall appropriate for an Irish pub and bar.  There is a pool table in the back which is in service when UFC is not playing.  Wherever you sit, you'll be able to see the screens with ease.

Another great point about this bar are the patrons.  People are so friendly and cool.  It's easy to start up a conversation with someone adjacent to you. The crowd is mostly 30 something, quite diverse and just well behaved.  You won't find any riff-raff in here!

There's nothing not to like about this place.  It's also conveniently one block from the 24th Street Mission BART station too.  See you at the next UFC fight!!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Not particularly impressive - meh food - their fried fish was way over battered/fried. And their drinks are just ok. There's a lot of seating and it's not too loud, but otherwise, there are lots of other bars I'd want to eat/drink at.
author: Abeer H.

description: Love this bar. I go there for decent food and the UFC events. No matter what I get, I usually have fries. I like their shepherd's pie, corned beef and cabbage, bangers and mash, and burgers. I haven't had anything bad here.
author: Alton Y.

description:
This place is my favorite neighborhood Irish bar. A lot of TVs, you can watch any game of any sport you can think of, from softball to soccer to UFC fights. The staff is incredibly friendly, and they always make sure to update me on the daily specials and offer recommendations for food and drink. 

Their food during happy hour is awesome, especially the wings. Excellent service, they really go above and beyond to make their customers happy.
author: Rachel B.

description: There is nothing about this establishment I would change. Great staff, selection, and ambience, if you'd prefer to converse with good company at an "inside voice" volume versus screaming at the top of your lungs, only to get a "what did you say", head here.
author: Ian M.

description: This place is terrible! Came for UFC 202 Mc Gregor fight and the place was way too crowed and hot with zero ventilation. Waitress was super rude and almost kicked me out when I asked that she turn on the fan or open the door. They closed it to keep other ppl outside from seeing parts of the fight so I guess us paying customers ($15 entrance fee) were just suppose to suffer. On top of that I never got the beer or the chicken fingers that I ordered. I'll never come back here, wish I could give it negative zero stars
author: ADIKA B.

description: I consider myself a burger snob and so I was skeptical when ordering the Big Ass Burger. Long story short, I'll be ordering it over and over again. Big recommendation if you like burgers.
author: Winter G.

description:
I discovered this place because I was craving for Shepherd's Pie and when I looked on Yelp, it was close enough to me so off I went to Napper Tandy. Small cozy neighborhood bar with Pub food, a good brunch menu.  Decor or lack of decor was plain,pretty drabby but I wasn't expecting much it was a pub.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  I have always come here during the day to eat lunch or brunch so it was never noisy or super busy.  I was able to enjoy my meal in peace.  

The food is really good! The Shepherd's Pie was delicious.  The burger was one of the best I have had in SF, really juicy and tasty.  Another thing that was surprisingly good was their Eggs Benedict and their Corned Beef Hash.  I was so happy after trying those you have to try it to know how good it is compared to other brunch spots.  For a pub I didn't expect to love the food but I did.  The atmosphere is fun and it a great place to have a drink with friends in the Mission!
author: Maria M.

description:
Best Irish pub in SF. Great food, service was quick and efficient, beers cold... What more could you ask for... Oh wait TVs for all the sports of course. 
I had the Irish breakfast.. Big greasy plate of goodness. Sausage, bacon, eggs, beans, pudding, and house made soda bread. Great place, Definitely will be back.
author: Alan O.

description:
Blimey! We came here the evenin' of St. Patty's Day, decked out in green to not get pinched. Probably is one of the closest Irish pubs nearby. Very appropriate, and very packed -- they still had extra tables set up on the sidewalk!

We got what I'd say were the mandatory "follow alongs" -- a Guinness with a shot of Jameson, followed by a true green beer. Which beer that one was is still up in the air (could have been Budweiser...?), but it actually made my hands and tongue green until morning!

Ultimately: good service, and I would request a specific beer for green if possible, but it was all for the Irish spirit. Time to kiss the Blarney Stone!
author: Garett T.

description: Just your normal run of the mill - college town type - Irish pub. My friends from Dallas felt right at home here.
author: Andrew K.

description:
It is what it claims to be.
Average Irish pub but excellent servers & some decent menu options for a bar.The salad was quite good. Wish there was more of a beer selection.
author: Ashley G.

description: Great place to watch a soccer game.  The fish tacos were tasty and the atmosphere was fun.  Pool table in the back with ample seating for large parties.
author: Trey C.

description:
I came here to watch the Matthysse vs Provodnikov boxing match, which they advertised in the window, and asked about it when I entered the bar.  Either they were having technical difficulties, or they didn't actually have access to HBO, I never found out which, but the fight didn't happen.  I hung out for about twenty minutes and nobody approached me about it to tell me, except another patron who was obviously here for the same reason.

My friend and I took a cab all the way across town to the Abbey Tavern on Geary, which reliably shows boxing as advertised.

This place seems like a pleasant enough little sports pub, but with the city being filled with such places, I feel like you need to be on your game for advertised events if you really want to draw people who aren't already regulars.  Maybe this place shines best when you come here to watch EPL soccer or something, but I wouldn't make plans to watch a big fight here again.
author: Gopal R.

description: A good alternative to Blackthorn for UFC fights. Pleasant staff.
author: Inigo M.

description:
So I was up in the area and rolling around SF with my homegirl Mai. We cruised over to the Mission as she wanted to hit up Knead and afew other hot spots. Well as we are cruising around just after Mission Carnival, we see this low marquee that advertises $6 for Rum Punch, Margaritas, and Sangrias. Since we were thirsty, well we just had to have a quick drink.

Being a lover of Rum, I had the punch. They had some citrus and strawberry flavors mixed in and it was delightfully refreshing. I would love to have a little neighborhood corner irish pub like this here in so cal. The corniced ceilings, wood paneling, mirrors, windows galore, I mean it was a great lil hot spot (arent all the corner bars in SF???). They were very busy here and it shows with quick efficient service with a smile. Rather peculiar for the Bay, but not too hard to believe in the mission.

The seats were comfy, and they had a sit down area further back with lots of tables to house the grub part of their service.

What was really crazy, was that this is an Irish bar, kinda obvious by its name. However due to the Carnival theme they tailored drinks to it in addition to playing some swanky latin music that easily made you sway to the rythem of the day. 

Overall, I really enjoyed this lil joint! Awesome stuff, check it out if you are in the area and need some refreshment ;)
author: Schel H.

description:
On Saturday and Sundays, they have a $5 breakfast special til noon. I'm on a budget so I was pleasantly surprised to find a reasonably priced Irish pub in the heart of the Mission. I actually found them on Scoutmob but I think I'll save that deal for when they don't offer a cheap special.

I ended up getting French Toast and a side of potatoes. The potatoes were a little cold but the French Toast was tasty and only $5 to keep this hungry girl from going hungry.

All of the staff members are super friendly and have lovely accents too. 

Just as I was finishing up it was getting crowded as people were watching football or soccer as the Americans call it.

I'm sure the drinks are pretty tasty as well.
author: Amy J.

description: I love this place. Great food. Excellent service. Can get pretty busy for Soccer, Baseball and basketball games but the bartenders are always attentive. I'll be back soon.
author: Steve G.

description:
Food: Delicious
Drinks: Great/wide selection!
People: Crowd is chill, fun, sports.  
Staff: They are great people, attentive, fun and nice : )
Overall: Go here, great sports bar, delicious food, fun atmosphere.
author: Tom T.

description:
Very cute Irish pub in an amazing neighborhood. Small and intimate and we were so pleasantly surprised to see that our waitress as well as many patrons were actually Irish! My friend and I split the Disco Fries (a sort of poutine dish), the entree-sized mac and cheese and the chicken pot pie.

Everything was very tasty but some of it wasn't exactly what I expected. Pot pie didn't have a lot of gravy and was VERY heavy on the potato, there was more chunks of that than peas, chicken, etc and not enough broth to properly soak everything up. On top was a MASSIVE puff pastry but the dish just wasn't juicy enough to warrant needing the bread; it just integrated with the potato to make it too starchy and thick. 

The mac and cheese was good but needed to be a bit creamier, would've liked some gooeyness while eating it. It had a great flavor though, and you can add things like bacon or tomato to it.

Generous portions, very attentive and friendly waitstaff, nice atmosphere. I imagine it's chaos when a game's on or an Irish holiday but at 1 PM on a Monday it was a nice, quaint, yummy place to grab lunch.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Drinks = good selection
They have seating in the back.  And they have some booth seating and some of those cling-to-the-wall kind of seats too.
Service = blah
Prices = okay.  I got a $5 glass of sangria.  
Big ass TV in the back area too.

I love the bathroom signs--Lads and Lasses. :)

Most entertaining thing here: the regulars.  lol
author: Fannie S.

description:
Napper had a $5 drink special going on as i walked by. dropped to this irish pub which also is a breakfast/sammie place. lots of flatscreens all around. 

setup: place looks/feels like a converted victorian. very cosy.

pour: bloody mary(5)
-strong drink with the various ingredients not integrated well. really tasted the worchester sauce....
-fast service considering how slammed the place was. waitresses not just serving drinks but fetching and serving breakfast.
-3ish stars

on draught:
-just a few mix drinks on special, no beers
-waitresses so busy they didn't have time to smile nor accept tips. gave it to them when they passed by again.
author: Victor G.

description:
This bar is THA BUSINESS! Jukebox, pool table, comfortable seats, food, drinks, music...cute sweet waitresses, big screen TVs, THA LIFE! My friend is studying for her class in behavioral psychology and I'm making a cookbook (yea...doesn't involve much cognition). I've been livin' that studying life for a minute but I am graduating this year and plan to never be in school again for my entire life...but my friend has to study so I'm gonna be supportive...SO here are my requirements for a cafe to study: bathroom, free wifi, plug point, open tables for my textbooks. Who would have thought that a bar can provide those same things...WITH margaritas! Woah! Where have I been? Why haven't I done this before? She's my hero! I feel like going back to school JUST to try and study drunk! Maybe I would have made some real educational revelations! 

I love this place and can't wait to come again (when I don't have to study, accompany someone studying, or when it's a Sunday) *although, Sundays are great here!
author: Leena B.

description: Great food and decent prices.  Go for the appetizer sampler or fish n chips!  The staff are great friendly people.  A genuine fun neighborhood bar.  Lots of TVs to watch the game from any seat.  Decent beer selection.
author: Zach T.

description:
I recently came to the Napper Tandy for a very sad, but fun going away party. The location is so close to Bart, that it makes for a great drinking hole. It was fun to see all my friends and meet a couple new ones. 

I was really tired, so I probably shouldn't have started with a Hot Toddy even though I love those. It was great but decided to move onto Redbull Vodkas to kick my butt into party mode. It worked. 

Also we had a most excellent time. Go Tapper Nandy!
author: Rebekah T.

description: Not great service- watching games and as soon as someone else wanted to watch some other game, Channel was changed. Didnt matter I was also a paying customer
author: Irma P.

description: I started out liking this place, they put the hockey finals on for us, planned to watch the whole game. Then it went downhill fast.       Waitress came by and says we have to pay $10 each because the UFC fight is coming on. I could give two shits about UFC. I wanted to order some more dinner and watch hockey. My complaint is that they didn't tell us we would be kicked out for UFC when we sat down. When we ordered another round they REALLY should have told us about the UFC thing. Complete BS, and a shitty way to treat customers, it really pissed me off.
author: Tim S.

description:
So everybody says "if you have a bad experience you'll tell ten people; if you have a good experience you'll tell one person."

Whelp, I had a bad experience at the Napper Tandy and told Yelp, which means very little. However, the general manager contacted me, apologized and offered to make it up to me. I happened to be in the 'hood a couple weeks later and went by for drinks. She was incidentally working the bar that day and after having a nice conversation I realized she was the woman I'd spoken to on Yelp.

She was absolutely lovely and even bought us a round, despite being stretched pretty thin with all the patrons.

I'd like to "publicly" give thanks to Marissa for being a great GM and a rad person. I love your bar and will continue to come by when I'm in the area.
author: Blake C.

description: Outstanding fish and chips. Coleslaw has the flavor I have been tasting for. Really enjoyable. Fish is not greasy and is light. Very flavorful. You will not be disappointed! 4 3/4 stars!!
author: Steve S.

description:
I came here to watch a late Sunday football game, and was slapped in the face with a mysterious charm of cozy, friendly, warmth.  Oh man, is this my kind of bar!  There is a roaring fire place, and the whole place screams warmth and cuddles and red cheeks and laughter.  How this is accomplished, I have no clue, but it is pretty wonderful!

Another great thing - this Irish bar....has actual Irish people working here!  Gives the whole experience even more charm (which I though wan't possible).  The bartenders were friendly and funny, and even invited our group to a holiday ornament exchange for the upcoming weekend.

Overall, even those this is a pretty standard bar, there is something about it that makes me feel at home, especially as SF starts to cool down through the winter months!
author: Stephanie R.

description:
In a neighborhood overrun by donut shops, taqueria this and taqueria that, and a plethora of Casas de Whatever, it good to see some diversity in the MIssion. And that is the Irish Pub Napper Tandy.

I stopped here for two reasons, first it wasn't a taco joint and second there was parking out front (a bigger deal that you might imagine if you've never driven in the city before).

The Napper Tandy is a popular place, cozy but much larger than it seems when you first walk in. An entire dining room is hiding behind the bar.

Their special was $5 Bloody Mary's. I'm very particular about my BM's so I gave one a try.....I ended up ordering two. This is a well rounded drink. Not as strong as any drink served at the New Patio in San Carlos (few places are) the mix was nonetheless worth drinking.

The mixture had a soft tomato flavor slightly sweet and non-astringent, moderately spiced with a hint of horseradish. I may have given another star for more horseradish.

While there I ordered their Sunday Special....two generous portions of pork loin, two eggs, two pieces of toast and a hill of seasoned potatoes. 

Another 3 star effort.

Why not 5? I ordered the eggs over medium, they came cooked to death.
The pork was just a smidge overdone and I did not eat the potatoes as they tasted off.

Overall though, the Napper Tandy has enough going for it in atmosphere, price and I saw enough other food coming out of the kitchen that I would like to try that I plan on coming back.

If I can find parking.
author: Elwood P. D.

description: Found this place by accident we had to use the restroom so we got a beer and stayed for more ... we got bacon cheese frys and chicken wings and it was DELISH! All recommended by our waiter don't know her name but she was tall and blonde and super sweet! Thanks again, we will def come back on our next trip to Frisco! Nice staff and great food and fair prices very satisfied
author: Stephanie S.

description: This place is so amazing fast on getting food out cheap prices friendly love this place great music come here its amazing.
author: Kyle M.

description:
Pretty cool place to watch a very boring Super Bowl. 

Bartenders are attentive. Drinks are decently priced. Food is standard- not bad at all. 

Best thing about this place is that there are tons of TVs and they turn the sound on really loud. Not a bad seat in the house really. 

Standard sports bar. I'll probably go back to watch a fight or a game because it's unpretentious and on my way home.
author: Sydney S.

description:
Went here yesterday with a friend of mine (12/13/14) first time here, lived on 24th and Shotwell over 20yrs ago, the neighborhood has changed!!!  

I had the full Irish Breakfast, OMG!!  Rashers, Sausages, Black and White Pudding, Potatoes, Baked Beans (I opted out of those) and Brown Bread, our server toasted mine for me (drools)!  I had a Bloody Mary with my meal yum, my friend had already eaten before we met up but he helped me eat mine as well lol.

Guinness was PERFECT, atmosphere was great, the staff attentive, and the crowd was diverse.

Will definitely go back the next time we are in the city!!
author: elizabeth m.

description:
Pros - all you can eat fish and chips (Monday special) is super tasty. Amazing cole slaw (i usually HATE coleslaw), fries are great and the white dipping sauce (flavored mayo?) was great. 

Cons - fish and chips were a bit oily. The food/drinks aren't the cheapest, but not unbelievable either.
author: Siva M.

description: There's a bar up in the Marina that has the slogan of "The non-Marina bar in the Marina".  I feel like the Napper Tandy is the non-Mission bar in the Mission, and that's just as good of a thing as the formerly mentioned bar is.  Laid back bar with what appears to be a healthy number of regulars and a low hipster quotient.  All of the food I saw coming out of the kitchen looked pretty great as well.  If I woke up tomorrow and discovered I was living in the mission (let's move past that nightmare quickly) I'm pretty sure this would end up being my local.
author: Joshua W.

description: This place is absolutely horrible!! I had the worst customer service experience in my life!! I would strongly recommend to never go there and support this type of establishment! I was there watching the game and I told them I wasn't sure what I wanted several times and because I didn't order within 10 mins they kicked me out and yelled at me.  I was nice the whole time until they kicked me out.  I will never go there again and support a place that treats people that way, I would hope you would do the same, you could be next!
author: Obie H.

description: It's all about the trivia here. Trivia all the time. Wednesday nights, so much fun. As for the rest of the bar, a pretty standard Irish pub.
author: Mel G.

description: I have only been here for breakfast but wow what a feast. Great full Irish. Highly recommend for those with a craving. Suggestion to management though. Maybe add brown/soda bread??  Thanks.
author: Dave O.

description:
I was visiting a friend and this is one of his hang outs and I LOVE IT!!! 

The bartender was hilarious, she was cracking jokes with us and other people that came into the bar. Everyone is very friendly and you can tell this place has it's regulars as they talk to each other across the bar. 

They have pool there and the bar stools are comfy. I like the set up at this bar.

They also have pool in the back and plenty of seating.

A must if you are in San Francisco!

Cheers!
author: Megan L.

description:
Came here on a random night to get a few drinks before meeting up with other friends. It was a cool bar with friendly servers. The bar was filled with people but there was a lot of room in the back.

$7 for Jameson drinks, 2.75 for redbull =  was not bad at all. My friends and I will definitely come here again!
author: Jay B.

description:
Love this place.  Fish Tacos are awesome, which seems strange for an Irish Pub, but hey, why question quality.  Everything else on the menu is pretty damned good as well.

Service is ALWAYS excellent and friendly.  The bartenders and waitresses are very attentive, and know how to keep patrons happy.
author: Vicente A.

description:
3.5* Been here once and I must say, for a dive bar, they have clean bathrooms with soap which is 1 star itself.  Food is decent to satisfying.  My bf and friends thought the wings were good, not great.  I had a Royal burger which didn't appear royal, but the taste made up for it.  Fried egg atop bacon and a medium thick patty? Mmm mm.  And they have an assortment of hot sauce.  Tasbasco? check. 2 kinds.  Sriacha for the Asian in me. Yes please.  I can't even spell it thanks to my whiteness.  And Tapatio the ultimate spice master.  Server was friendly which is a plus.  

As for the actual place, there's one pool table which was always occupied; I wanted to play. Booth seating for dining.  And a bar in the front.  I guess I'm not used to dive bars, but it wasn't the nicest looking interior.  I'd probably only come by for late night food and a drink before going to another place.

I conclude: come for late night food and pitchers of beer- yes.  Come to sit and catch up with friends.  Do not enter if you want to dance, stand around, or expect entertainment besides the people or hopefully nice people you may meet because everyones sitting besides pool players.  Cheers.
author: Kimberly C.

description: Servers were quick, bar food was bar food, shots were big.  Came here to watch the mayweather pacquiao fight, good spot for it.  Was hot as hell inside, but their were mad ppl, but they handled it well.
author: christopher h.

description:
Napper Tandy isn't a bad spot, but I did have an annoying experience this weekend though.

My girlfriend and I went to watch a March Madness game and saw the happy hour sign outside that advertised $3 Sierra Nevada bottles so we walked in and ordered 2 Sierra Nevadas. One bartender took our order and gave it to another bartender, who poured us two Sierra Nevada drafts and not the bottles.

The bartender who gave us the drinks said "that will be $10 guys" and then I mentioned the sign outside. She said that drafts are not in the special. I told her that it doesn't make sense to assume that a paying customer would not want the advertised deal, or that it wouldn't be given on default even though we didn't specify "bottles". She just stared at us and repeated "$10, sorry guys". We ended up paying anyways, just cause we didn't want to miss the game.

The $4 is difference (paying $10 instead of $6 total) is not a big deal, it's just a matter of principle. I'm still new to the city, but I probably won't be going back anytime soon. there are too many other awesome bars in the Mission with better customer service. 

I just want to give a heads up to other Yelpers that they can't assume the bartenders here will give happy hour specials unless you specify directly.
author: Dan R.

description:
The bartenders are nice. 

Food is average to below for a pub. 

Worst part is the beers are bad, not the selection but the way they pour. Not sure if it's a problem with the lines or the CO2 or what, but they pour bad tasting brew. Also frequently warm. Unacceptable for a pub...completely. 

This place really lost me when I stopped in one day and ordered a Racer 5 and a shot. I already new they were subpar but I was in a hurry headed to bart. When I walked in I heard the owner behind the bar discussing with patrons and workers how some lines had become crossed and certain beers were not pouring with the corresponding tap. When I got my Racer it was immediately obvious it wasn't a Racer, so I let the owner know but said I'll drink it anyway because I'm in a rush. She actually argued with me that she definitely knew it was a Racer (it wasn't).  Not only was the beer warm with low carbonation tasting horrid, but she sold me a heferveisen and insisted it was a solid IPA. Ridiculous. 

Again, the bartenders are very nice. I also like the owner, despite this experience. Danielle is hot. However avoid this place if your heart is set on an ice cold, crisp, fresh tasting brew of exceptional quality.
author: don h.

description: Great place for a morning beer! Authentic Irish patrons and bartender!
author: Jake L.

description:
Knock 'em down.

Hungarian style: http://youtu.be/2YhshSW02Gw

Irish style: Excellent egg white veggie omelet with sides of roasted potatoes and beans followed by a hunger defeating veggie burger and side salad.

Server couldn't have been more friendly, genuine and accommodating. Those egg whites came with no extra charge. Perks of asking nicely.

Myon & Shane 54 owned me. I owned this meal.

Everyone won this game of dominoes.
author: Jason B.

description:
Awesome...Awesome and more awesome, covered in awesome sauce!  This place has made a complete 180 compared to where it was even 6 months ago.  It used to be a cramped dive bar with mediocre food and cheap drinks to keep the locals coming back, but now I would travel to eat here and even just to hang out.  

The bar area is open and airy, more loungy like vs. cramped and divey!  The dining room is much more spacious and welcoming.  The bathrooms are immaculately clean and the smell does not permeate the surrounding areas any longer.  They now have a projector screen by the pool table in the back to watch games on.  

Okay...now that I've covered the atmosphere, let's talk about the food...yowzers!  All you can eat fish and chips on Mondays...finger lickin good!  Absolutely amazing...Plate after plate of mouth watering, succulent deep fried goodness piled atop hand cut french fries!  What more can you ask for???  All the other food is good too!  I usually get the Chicken Pesto sandwich and that's even gotten better since the upgrades (which also include trained chefs).  

And last, but most certainly not least, the bartenders!  Lisa and Amanda!  Best of the Bay material...I love them both.  If you haven't checked out the Napper, you need to put it on your list.  I promise you will not regret it.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
napper tandy's is my most favorite bar in the mission.  MY MOST FAVORITE BAR.  i loved it when i first moved into the neighborhood two years ago and i still love it.

they recently upgraded the space - inside and out!  and it looks AWESOME.  unfortunately, karaoke on saturday's is no longer but they still have trivia on wednesday's, they still have the same great staff, strong drinks and now there's more room to sit and order food and get all types of tipsy.

somehow, i don't know how, but shit always happens at napper's.  not bad shit though.  good shit.  always good shit.  i've taken a handful of out town visitors here and months later they say how much they miss napper's.
author: Lauren P.

description: Loved it. Authentic Fish 'n Chips with British vinegar. All you can eat Monday's.  I could've used a wheelbarrow to leave. Definitely going back.
author: David R.

description:
The housemate and I headed here to catch the Giants game 6. We were lucky enough to find a seat just in time. Within minutes, the bar got super packed with people and the drinks started flowing. There were 2 waitresses that I could see (plus the bartender). Without a second of delay, the waitresses came right up to our table and for the rest of the evening tended to all their customers as if they were the only people in the bar. Very polite, relaxed and attentive.
We had some garlic fries, which were great and a couple beers each. The prices are reasonable, the bathrooms are spotless and the WAITRESSES have special waitressing powers or something because they were awesome. 
Definitely recommend this place.
author: Megan B.

description:
8:30 on Wednesdays are trivia quiz night.  Bring your brain trust, stomach and funny hats (can't remember why though).

We arrived with a Groupon, unknowingly it was trivia night.  Nice to exercise the brain once in awhile.

It's a pub with the usual beers but it also had slightly more elevated food menu than expected.  We started with a mixed green salad with balsamic vinegar, then beef stew + fish and chips, and finally a decadent fudge brownie with whipped cream.  Meals were delicious and bar staff friendly and helpful.

A couple of dark ales and waters later, it was trivia time- 6 rounds.  We lasted 3 before calling it a night but did pretty well...3rd place.  Believe the first prize was a $30 gc @ Nappy Tandy's.

Cheers to a friendly pub where everybody is glad you came.
author: Jen L.

description:
A pretty good Full Irish Breakfast, but certainly not the best in the City.  And either their plates are too big or their servings are too small - it's disappointing to see so much open space on the plate.  The toasty soda bread was amazing.  Great bloody marys - and at only $5, destroys Fiddler's $10 average bloody mary.

Service was pretty darn cheerful considering we were there the morning after St. Pat's.  

We didn't have a session here, just breakfast, so I can't judge on the bar.
author: Meg W.

description:
My girls and I ducked in here on a rainy Saturday night. The front area is small so it gets packed fairly quickly, especially once karaoke starts.

Our bartender was awesome - she was super friendly and gave me generous pours on my Dark & Stormies. The best part was - they were only $4 and it wasn't even happy hour! 

Karaoke provides non-stop entertainment - at one point we formed a cheer section for our friend as she went up and rocked out to "I Love Rock & Roll."

Rock on!
author: Mariela D.

description:
Friday night, meeting some friends for a going away send off. 

I arrive and sit at the bar with xx. The rest of our group slowly trickles in. We are now congregating at the bar, deciding on what to order. 

Bartender S: Hey, are you guys Yelpers?

We nod in confirmation. 

Bartender S: I knew it! I recognize you guys from your reviews and talk. (points) You're xx, and you're xx, and you're xx, etc. Points to What's his name, I know you too but I can't remember your name. 

What's his name: Um, I'm the only black dude in San Francisco. 

HA HA!

====================================

Favorite part of the evening: Watching xx sit on XX's lap, doing an impersonation of a ventriloquist act. 

Most disappointing part of the evening: Not having all my orifices ravaged as was promised. Bye sweetie, we'll miss you!

One star off for not having red stripe and my watered down drink. (Not poured by Bartender S).
author: Chum L.

description: Was digging this place , nice sized , and people were having a great time , the vibes were good , and they had some very beautiful lady's working behind the bar with great personality , will be coming back next time I'm in town
author: Anthony M.

description:
This is a nice little Irish bar but I really really really wish they'd lose the pool table in the back that takes up half the damn place and is usually played by a bunch of obnoxious drunks who ask you to move out of the way so that they can miss their shots.

The bar is a lot smaller than it looks from the outside, and that's due to the damn pool table and a narrow connection between the back of the bar and the front. The front of the bar can get really crowded and when it's cold, the draft from the door can wreck you.

Tables are reserved for food-ordering folks but there are bar stools around the bar where you can down your Guinness. They do pour a real mean Guinness, courtesy of  the lovely Irish bartenders who will sass you if you sass them. TVs are set up in the front bar but they generally play football (the kind  where if you call it soccer to an Irish fan, they will reward you with a punch to the neck).

Their bar food is quite good! I wasn't expecting it but not half bad as far as bar food goes and the prices are decent.

Most of the bar was filled with Irish ex-pats and some random Mission folk. No hipsters, which made it a huge plus in my book. I will love it much more, though, when it gets rid of the damn pool table!
author: Logan The H.

description:
Date of visit: 4/16/16

Let me start off by saying the food was great! Definitely exceeded what I expected to get for an order of wings and fries. Delicious! 

The service?! HORRIBLE!! I would give our "SERVER #2" (as the receipt showed) a big FAT 0. Just a super bad experience. She either seemed too comfortable with her type of service or just didn't care. We walked in, got sat by her. As soon as we got sat, she asked us what we wanted to drink but as though it was a bother for her to ask. Both my friend and I ordered a Bloody Mary (delicious by the way). Once our Bloody Mary's were brought to us by SERVER #2, she asks us if we are ready to order and we say yes. She then says, "Ok. What do you want?" Ummm...last I know, NO server asks anyone in that way. Are you kidding me?! We order and immediately walks away as soon as we are finished speaking. Did you like have to use the restroom or something that it was necessary to walk away so fast as soon as we were done ordering?! Our food comes out about 10 minutes later but someone else other than her brings it out. We take a few bites and are need of more napkins and want another BM. Where is our server?! A table of 4 gets sat next to us. Immediately she re-appears again and goes over to them, takes their drink order. Ummm...hello?! As soon as I see she is done taking their drink order and is about to walk away I say "Excuse me, can we please get some napkins and 2 more BM's please?" And she says, "Yep!" and AGAIN zooms away. Again....okaaaay? 5 minutes later brings us the BM's but this time, SLAMS them on the table and goes to the table next to us to take their order. That to me just did it. I was mad, upset, and ready to finish eating to get out of there. Never, EVER have I had THAT horrible of service!! So never asked us how the food tasted, never checked on us to see if we needed anything, and never asked if we were ready for the tab. WE had to ask for it. We ask and brings it immediately. As soon as we put the cards out, she was quick to come and get them from us. Brought our cards back with the receipts. I never, ever leave $0, but I was soooo tempted to. We ended up leaving her $4 so she knew her service was not appreciated one bit along with a little note of advice. I never complain but this time, I truly felt it was needed! So server #2, if you are always giving this type of service, maybe serving is just not meant for you.
author: Veronica C.

description:
Good service, decent prices, decent food: I ordered a chicken caesar salad, and they were generous with the chicken portions (and it was warm) Also came with soda bread, which was pretty good.  
Bonus, I left a bag there and the bartender had it for me behind the bar when I came back.  (I know that's often expected but it was a great feeling)
author: Eva L.

description: Have not been back to spend my money here because their service was disgusting. I am sad to say I loved their happy hour and that they have modelo on tap but I can not bring myself to be in an establishment where I feel unwelcome.
author: Karen M.

description:
As far as bars go Ive probably said this before I like to drink and if they are serving then its a great bar.

Pool Table = yes
Full bar = yes
Pitchers = yes
Darts = NO (sad face) most bars don't
Food = decent (bar food)
vibe = divvy but quiet enough that you can talk to people on most nights.
Outside seating = yes
Drunk Homeless people nearby = always
Stinky = probably
Accepts Credit Cards = YES
Fun = yes (but thats because they have alcohol)

Drink up!
author: Joseph M.

description:
Came in here last night after foreign-language-study-date-with-attractive-friend and had a good time. The waitress, who I believe was named Lisa, was really friendly and accommodating, smiling lots and even closing the door to keep us all warm. I had the Veggie Burger and actually preferred it to the one I had a week before at the more fancy Urbun Burger. It was also $3 cheaper. With good company, a nice pint and several games playing on TVs around the bar, it was a pretty perfect night.

This is why I love Irish pubs.

They also have rotating food specials throughout the week. For example, every Monday, they offer all-you-can-eat Fish and Chips. I wondered to myself just how much fried fish and potato I could put away before exploding and becoming a threat to national security. Not much, I don't think.
author: Keane L.

description: Great atmosphere with a welcoming horseshoe shaped bar. I had a few pints of Guinness along with a fish and chips -- both were excellent.  The burger also looked good.  It was fairly full when I stopped by on a Sunday afternoon, but my friends and I were able to locate three stools together at the bar. I'll definitely go back at some point. If I were closer, I might just be a regular.
author: Brad C.

description:
Napper Tandy is great place to go to after work....weather is with co-workers, friends or even with my  child to play some pool.

The atmosphere there is very friendly, specially bartender Smiley Lisa! She kno almost everyone who is in there and treats everyone great. I go there almost every Friday, and she makes me feel very welcomed, and she always greets my lil girl with a big hug. 

Weather I only go to grab a beer with friends, or for some dinner and a pool game with friends and kids...we are sure to have a good time!

Their food is delicious, specially the fish tacos are glorious, and the new look the Napper has is very clean and cool. And their happy hours are gnarly!

I def recommend this restaurant bar!
author: elena s.

description: Excellent local Irish bar. Great food, great place to play pool and shoot the shit.
author: Michael L.

description: Awesome Shepard's pie and great beer selection. We had a party of 4 and walked in at 7 and found a table immediately. Fast and friendly service
author: Amanda C.

description: This is a great place for breakfast and booze. Last World Cup it was one of two spots I'd go to virtually every single day. No matter how crowded it is, the staff is super attentive and totally nice. The food is good, especially the breakfast fare. Stiff drinks , affordable prices
author: Lauren V.

description: Great atmosphere, incredibly friendly bartenders, good food. They have a great jukebox and tons of screens for watching sports. Pool tables in the back are typically open and I typically stop there whenever showing visiting friends around town.
author: Patrick S.

description:
On a recent night, I popped in to have a drink on my way home.  Before I even sat down, the blonde gal working  the bar barked, "THE KITCHEN IS CLOSED!"

I replied, "Umm, okay, well actually I don't want anything to eat, I'm here for a drink"

About 10 minutes later, a guy walks in, sat on the barstool next to me, and asked if he could see a menu. The same gal working the bar said, "Let me see what the kitchen has remaining ..."

She returned from the kitchen, and informed the guy that he could have fish & chips. He said, "Great, I'll have that"

I'm just wondering... did the blonde gal working the bar simply have something against latinos (after all, the guy who strolled in TEN minutes after the kitchen closed, was white, and he got served food).  I'll take my business to a place that doesn't hire prejudice bartenders.
author: Ted K.

description:
The Napper what? The Napper who? 
Those were the questions I asked a few years ago when my friend, Randy, asked me to join him for a trivia night (and that's when my love for pub trivia began!). All I knew was that it was some Irish pub in the outer Mission. It was an awesome first experience at TNT. Found a parking spot right in front of the bar, ordered and enjoyed yummy pub food, drank a few rounds (or more) of beer, and came in 2nd place for trivia (not bad for a 2 person team)! Awwwyah! For the 2nd place victory, we got $20 (I think) credit for TNT. Sweet! 

Been to TNT several times, and always good fun! It gets pretty crazy on Friday and Saturday nights, but I just recently stopped in for a drink and grub on a Sunday night and the crowd was pretty light (considering it was St. Patty's Day weekend!). Ordered a grilled cheese on sourdough with a green salad (or fries). This was a very good GC, especially since it was on sourdough! Green salad was mixed greens with a nice balsamic vinaigrette. 

Service is good at TNT and food is tasty and reasonably priced (for pub fare). Cool ambiance, and the front area has a few tables by the door, but more stools around the bar. There's a cool jukebox with a sweet selection of songs from Journey, U2, Beastie Boys, etc.,  Additionally, there a bunch of TVs for your sports viewing pleasure. 

Will be back to TNT! More fun times to be had. 
Erin Go Braugh! 
(In honor of St. Patrick's Day, I'll be yelping all Irish establishments this week!)
author: Gill C.

description:
This is just for brunch. And it hurts.

If you like to brunch on the weekends with your dog and not a whole lot of other people, this place is it. And on Saturday, this is the activity of choice for us. You can have an Irish server who is both friendly and an excellent waitress....

Or you can go on Sunday, where you have this one server who is as sweet as anything, but is not a good server, and what's worse, for some reason they make her work alone on a weekend.

Last Sunday, we hosted out friends from Santa Cruz who had heard how we love the Irish bar that allows dogs. I saw that server, and I knew it would be a disaster. It was. She didn't write down any of our order (why do servers do that? Please write it down. After a certain age, everyone's memory just isnt' as good) Our coffee tasted like water, our eggs were cold and she forgot our soda bread. 

During our last Sunday visit, the dirty dishes from the guests before us were still on the bar when we left. Gross.

I'm posting this because I would want to know if I was making a mistake so I could fix it. Please Slapper Nappy, get some help for her on Sunday!
author: Suzanne R.

description:
Around the age of 4 - I raided my parents tape collection. I listened to the Eagles, Beach Boys, Beatles, and Abba non-stop for a good two years.

But Abba was my favorite. I used to choreograph interpretative dances to each one of their songs, and make my bewildered mom sit and watch.

Me: "Money, Money, Money....must be funny, in a rich man's world"  (throwing monopoly money everywhere)

Probably the best hour of her life (in my opinion).

So yesterday, when I was in the Mission and heard Abba trickling out of The Napper Tandy, I knew I had no choice but to go inside.

I ordered up a vegetable pastie. Thick greasy flaky dough, filled with curried vegetables. It was decent, though a little expensive, and the service was a little slow.

The quaint front bar area reminded me of the pubs I used to go to when I was younger in Wales: warm and community-oriented.

I don't know if I'll be heading back anytime soon, but if I ever have the urge to belt out some Dancing Queen karaoke  - it's reassuring to know that I don't have to look too hard.
author: Jessica T.

description: Napper Tandy! Always a good time, full of good people, and the service is utterly amazing. Lisa, Emma, Leoni,  Sherri,  Shersa, Catrina, Janet, Franchisca and the onwer Marissa give their heart and soul to this establishment as well as their customers. Food is great,  drinks are fairly priced amd promt, and the energy is always fabulous. Thank you Napper. Will be back... daily!
author: Darian B.

description:
LISA IS THE BEST!!!

I went there last Sunday for the Mexico soccer game and it was packed and crazy and hectic, but Lisa, the bartender, was so attentive, so nice, so amazing! She was so patient and didn't look rushed or frustrated because of all the people. She even offered me a taste of a beer I hadn't tried before.  Usually bartender can be huge a*** when it's crazy busy and crowds, but she wasn't.  

Overall I think she has excellent service and such friendly vibe/personality.

Thanks Lisa :)

I didn't try the food, but it looked sooooo good!
author: Katherine K.

description:
Yep thank you Napper Tandy for being what you are. Overcrowded?? No way. Over priced?? No way. Lines?? No way. Just as a neighborhood bar should be. Perfect place to grab a drink when you just want a little r & r.
Bartenders are always friendly and are sure to offer to fill your beer up before it appears to be empty. Clean enough with dim lighting and comfortable seats.
author: Jamie B.

description: Interesting place a block or so away from the Bart station... A lot of flies (actual flies) around the bar, but the service made up for it(super-friendly bartender). In full disclosure, I wound up here around 2pm on a Thursday, and was the only one in the place... So I can't really  bash them too much.
author: Robert J.

description: Omg... Best Irish food in the city. Live music. Can't beat it. Shepard pie and chicken pot pie both amazing.
author: Tony T.

description: Came here last night with some friends on an impromptu pub crawl. It was pretty busy still at 8:30 on a Friday but still got a table. The server was quick to respond and very friendly. The cocktails were reasonably strong and priced. Mixed clientele but all seemed cool. Didn't try the food but quite a few people in the back were eating.
author: Scott G.

description:
Mediocre breakfast at a decent price ($5 entrees before noon, $9 after that, $5 bloody mary).

Service wasn't great, but they were slammed during Carnaval so I'm guessing it'd be better on a normal weekend. Our server was irritated that we had a Groupon-like coupon on the phone vs. printed, so be aware of that and print a coupon beforehand. 

Cheap is good, but I think you get less than what you pay for here.
author: Kimberley D.

description:
BEWARE! ACHTUNG! CAUTION!

If you go to the Napper Tandy with LAUREN P you might end up TIME TRAVELING.

If you are not prepared for time travel, hold onto something stable. Even though the patrons are all friendly try to stop stealing the karaoke mic - Ken is not your "constant."
Everything will be fine, eventually.
author: Gabriel B.

description:
The owners/staff have always been helpful and nice, and it's a great dive, in the best sense of the word. 

Surprisingly, the food is very good and very reasonably priced. I've had 'brunch' a few times, and after a great $5 breakfast and a few of their very very good bloody mary's... well, I've had fun. They also have mimosas in case your sister is coming along. She also had fun. 

They have a thing going on every night, whether is a pub quiz, endless fisn-n-chips, or 'bring your iPod' night. Awesome times.
author: Aaron B.

description:
There's lots of beer on tap, happy hour drink and appetizer specials, a full menu of pub food, big booths in the back, real Irish staff and pool. It's also super BARTable and way chill. I am far from impressed by their liquor selection but oh well - you can't have it all.

Happy hour is from 5-7pm:
-1/2 off ALL appetizers: Fries, garlic parmesan fries, bacon cheddar fries, chicken wings, potato skins, mozarella sticks, beer battered onion rings, chicken fingers, fried calamri
-$3 well drinks
-$3 bottled domestic beer (alternates)
-$5 select cocktail (alternates)
author: Kristina A.

description: After watching a Food Channel show about Fish Tacos we decided to drive to the Mission and get some.  This bar is fine, and the comments about friendly staff are correct.  But, the food was tasteless.  The Fish, which I was told is Cod, had neither taste nor texture, the Pico de Gallo was equally bad.  It had no heat, no spices, it just sat on the plate with the Cole Slaw, basically doing nothing, adding nothing to the taste experience at all.  Too bad, as walking through the door I had great expectations.  Order a Bloody Mary, but stay away from the Fish Tacos.
author: Mike K.

description:
This place has gone downhill. Or at least, it's having schizo moment, depending on time of day. The last time we were here, a couple years ago on st. patrick's day had a respectable shepard's pie. That's when it was in Irish bar mode.

But last night, it was almost empty on a Friday night at 10 pm -- yet the booths were covered in beer glasses from who knows when. There was a fancy cocktail menu with Miami style clip art and ketel one drinks, that didn't fit in at all, plus a second wine menu???  The bartender was slow and confused, even though there was no one else there.  You might say it was the location...but we went to two other even more out of the way bars in the neighborhood and they were bustling (Treat Street and the Phone Booth) that night.

The Napper Tandy may not be long for this world.
author: Vanessa H.

description: Love the atmosphere, very friendly. Marisa (sp?) Was amazing! I am definitely coming here again and will recommend this place to everyone I know...
author: Josue G.

description: Ok so I celebrated my birthday here... And I don't remember anything. Ok so up to what I do remember... I came here with a couple of friends who decided to go bar hopping in mission district. We stumbled upon this place after passing on a couple of other bars that were either cash only or had cover. Once we walked in we could feel the nice vibe of the place, everyone was having a jolly time chatting it up and the bartenders were busy serving up drinks to everyone. So my friends and I started off with AMF's for everyone and that was when we started to get into this random conversation with these two hilarious Irishmen. As soon as they heard it was my birthday they wanted me to get a shot of whiskey. Me, feeling bad that it was just me taking a shot decided to buy a shot for everyone. And that's how the night started to get rolling. 3 more shots and a Long Island later I am starting to brown out. That's when the conversations started to get much more deep on a personal level. That's when I realized that we were actually in an Irish pub and that Irish people are freaking hilarious. They would clown on you so hard but got the vibes going up. Yeah I don't remember anything else after that except a faint memory of throwing up right outside the pub. That's how you know this place is cracking lackin.
author: Joe Z.

description: Napper Tandy pours a great pint of Guinness. But mostly importantly, it makes THE BEST FISH AND CHIPS.
author: L P.

description: Great service! Good ass food! Best pub in the Mission!
author: Main G.

description:
My local after work cocktail stop on Fridays. The beer is good, and the girls who pour it are nice.

They have a pool table in the back, which makes for fun after you've downed a few. Watch out for Beau, the local pool shark.

They serve food here, and I've only had the Shepherd's pie, but it was pretty good.
