Funky mixed crowd. You'll get Latinos (you're in the Mission, duh), some Irish ex-pats, and your regular smattering of local bar room characters. If you're lucky, you might even see me!
author: Wes T.

description: Lovely ladies behind the bar and amazing comfort food. Always welcomed with that Irish love and the Guiness Braised Beef Stew...I die for it every time. Tender pieces of meat paired with fresh, rustix veggies and mash. I want to marry this place.
author: Charmae C.

description: Walked in not knowing what to expect. The bloody marys are cheap and good. Made from a mix so I knocked off a star. Had the Louisiana eggs benny and they were really good. The sausage was nice and flavorful with a spice to it. Great atmosphere,  a good place to catch the game. Bartender is nice and attentive.
author: Jenny B.

description:
Cool sports bar/irish pub on the corner of 24th and South Van Ness.

Great place to catch a game because this place is chock full of flatscreens.

Clientele is pretty mellow and very friendly.

All the barmaids are cute little Irish lasses who from the accents you can tell, probably know a thing or two about booze.  They do not disappoint serving up drinks lightning quick even when this place is packed.  Prices for drinks are pretty decent, if I remember right they have $3 pints of Pacifico on draft, that's not too bad.

Food is decent.  I can say that the Guinness Irish beef stew is pretty tasty.  The fish and chips always looks and smells bomb so I'll have to check that out sometime.  One of my homies said the shepard's pie sucks though so probably stay away from that.  The bacon cheddar fries are amazing, but that's no surprise because you're taking three things that are awesome on their own and combining them.

Ample street parking in the neighborhood and about a block or two from the Mission and 24th BART station.
author: Brad R.

description: Actually 3.5 stars, but not possible to  give half star ratings.  Good drinks, good bar, tasty burgers and fries.  My husband had the bangers and mash and said they were bangin!  Reminded him of his Gran.
author: Heather S.

description:
The Napper Tandy is one of those great local bars where you can get a tasty order of fish n' chips on a Saturday night and not have to fight through a sea of drinking locals to get it.

The bar staff (all Irish ladies) are friendly and quick with the bringing of victuals and ale. The prices are good and the portions ever better. A half order of fish n' chips should satisfy any normal hunger. The mozzarella sticks are also delicious, and with ranch instead of the usual marinara.
author: Nick S.

description: Food was pretty good, and server was nice. I enjoyed the chicken pot pie and green salad (just lettuce tossed in a balsamic vinaigrette). The food there is very filling. There was a steady stream of patrons in and out around 8:30 on a Thursday night. Not sure it's a place I would recommend, since there are many other spots for a drink in the area. But if you want a place that is relaxed and easy for a beer and quick bite, this is a solid neighborhood spot.
author: Katelyn M.

description:
We went over for a quick pub dish-also to see the Giants vs Braves and let me tell you....the food was DELICIOUS!  Usually one will receive so so food at a bar but this Irish pub has it all.  Dive bar with tvs everywere with great service and yummy food.  They have prices you can work with in SF...not to mention daily specials like all you can eat fish and chips on Mondays!  I had the pesto chick sanwich with homemade cut fries(YUM) and John had the fish and chips.  Beer battered onion rings as a side dish...best I have ever had.
Def a place we will visit again......
author: Jenny G.

description:
Pool table?  I didn't know they had a pool table in here.  You'd think I'd have noticed that.  Anyway, don't know what it's like here at night, but was here early evening with the McPhee, drinking in the mission, celebrating the bad economy and playing the proverbial violin as Rome burns. (For the record, the fiddle or violin wasn't even invented yet during the great fire of 64 AD in first century Rome)

Bartender was okay, patrons were interesting and I liked how the door opens up to give you a birds eye view of the world going by.  Didn't see any douches inside...perhaps it was a little too early.

Drinks were sufficiently strong and reasonable...I'd consider going back someday.
author: Roy N.

description:
Just about everything I want in a neighborhood bar.  Decent selection of taps, reasonably priced.  Capable of producing the standard basic mixed drinks.  It's big value-add: they're food is really good and reasonably priced - the burgers especially, although the same goes for the Fish & Chips.  

The bar is split into two rooms; a big bar in the front, and a bunch of booths with a pool table in the back.  

People who work there are actually Irish, with awesome accents.  

There's a good but hard Pub Quiz on Weds nights, that's run without any nonsense of a music round.  

Only missing the fifth star because I doubt I would travel far to go here, although I'm grateful it is near me.
author: Zachary R.

description:
I really like this bar. The bartenders are pretty friendly, and the food here is pretty good. There are tables in the back if you want to get drinks and food, and sit where it's a little easier to talk. But damn! The karaoke here is pretty off top. And especially awkward. 

I love karaoke bars, especially ones that blast the music to cover up the bad singing- and all the singers don't give a fuck. Karaoke isn't about impressing people to me. That's why I like this place. 

Cheap beer, bad karaoke, good people...all for a great night!
author: Lauren S.

description:
Pub Quiz!

Good service and all the bar staff are Irish ladies with accents. How awesome is that!?!?!?
author: Skye W.

description: Great place to relax or watch a game and have a beer with friends. I don't know why, but I was really surprised to find so many Irish people in an Irish bar. The staff and most of the patrons were from the emerald isle or the nearby UK. The Irish curry there was exactly as delicious as it was when I had during my months in Ireland, and the vibe in the bar was relaxed and friendly. So much so that the people sitting next to us got the wrong kind of salad and instead of sending it back, they gave it to us, then we bonded over triathalon's and tough mudder, small world. I did have a little giggle at watching some openly gay Irish men playing pool and grabbing eachother's bums, as during my time in Ireland I learned that most guys are so "manly" that they deny even having gay friends, their loss! Had a great night, will go back next time I'm in the mission area.
author: Courtney L.

description: Irish pub, straight up.  Good and solid.
author: Jason K.

description:
Nappies! I've been here numerous times and have yet to be let down. I've watched the olympics, an amazing performance of Gangsta's Paradise, and lurve talking to the bouncer with the dreamy accent.

Go buy drinks here, sing a few songs, and have a fun time!
author: Allegra F.

description: We stopped here to waste some time before heading to the airport cause we had a late flight. It's an Irish bar with Irish food and Irish bartenders. We didn't try the food but this Asian family was trying everything on the menu and it all looked good. It's a  pretty cool bar, has a pool table, LCD tv's, and the bathroom was one of if not these cleanest I've ever seen in a bar. We went during happy hour and were told that the Blue moon and Pilsner beers were $3 which is really cheap. When we got the bill they were actually $4 not $3 but who cares cause that's still cheap. Sucks for the bartender though cause she would have gotten a bigger tip. Since we only had 3 beers we thought $9 would be the total and was gonna give $15 which would have been a $6 tip but instead she got a $3 tip.
author: Josh B.

description: A great place to sip your pint and watch whatever ball game happens to be on at the moment, though my eyes are always on the soccer.  Friendly bartenders and good pub grub too.  There are a variety of meatless options on their extensive menu, and the kitchen is nice about letting you sub a veggie patty on one of their regular burgers.  Much appreciated!
author: Heidi D.

description:
WHY WHY DO ALL THE DOUCHEBAGS CONGREGATE HERE??? 

just wanted to enjoy some monday nigh football, but unfortunately, i was cringing too much to pay attention. 

obnoxious shouting and mission hipster kids who are apparently in some competition to see who can be more pretentious. ugh. 

didn't really have anything there except for a beer. the waiter was nice, but nothing special. two stars just because the service was decent.
author: Jean L.

description:
From the perspective of a weekend daytime patron I can honestly say it's a great little bar.  
Local patrons, unassuming crowd, many Irish.  Straight/gay/older/younger/whatever.  The food always hits the spot (I like the "full Irish"), and Lorna, the always luvverly n'fun Scottish bartender, pours very wonderful Bloody Mary's and trades wit and repartee with the locals.
TV usually a mix of Euro soccer and US sports.
author: David P.

description: Great hangout in general but sometimes the kid-friendliness of it gets to me. I think it's great there are little ones in there, and it reminds me of England a lot but sometimes I just want to chill with my pint with just the sounds of a TV and the drunk next to me. Appetizers could offer some non-fried foods that might hint at healthiness but overall, I like the pub.
author: Dan-o T.

description:
I've been here many, many times and I have to say that it is hit and miss.  Particularly, there is one bartender that is such a damn grouch every time you ask for a drink.  Unless your Irish of course, and then she will make it rain with booze (I've seen it).

But one bad apple can't spoil the bunch.  The rest of the staff is great and always up to converse with you.  The drinks are priced fair and the food is great for being pub grub.  Their cheddar bacon fries are AWESOME, especially when you have a hungry group.

Give it a shot as it is still a fun place!
author: Joseph B.

description: I've been walking by this place for years.  After seeing they remodeled and Groupon got me in the door. I brought the family in for dinner.  We sampled the fried calamari and fish taco appetizers.  The calamari with aioli was decent but the fish tacos were very good.  We also tried, Fish & Chips (with malt vinegar of course!), Shepherds pie, Bangers and Mash and the Guinness Beef stew.  All dishes were very solid pub grub; homey, with larger portions -- perfect for a cool night.  The beef stew was very flavorful.  Dessert choices were a variety of pies and cheesecake.  The wait staff very friendly and busy.  They covered both the bar and the dining areas.  It wasn't full but it was only 6pm on a Wednesday.  The Sugar Bowl was on several large screen TV.
author: Shane C.

description: Great foood, good servive.  Will be back try the Pastami.
author: George M.

description:
A great set of taps fairly deep in the mission.  I've spent almost every monday night over the past couple years there with my co-ed soccer team after our games.  Lorna, runs the bar, and keeps the pints coming, while the kitchen serves up some solid Irish pub food as well.  The jukebox is always usually rolling through some random concoction of early 90's rap, indie rock, and some random electronic music every now and then.  

All in all everything I look for in a place to dive in and have a beer with a group of friends without any presumptions.  great place, I'll be going there as long as I'm around SF, thats for sure.  Not sure who was there when Sammy ( below ) was there.  The bartenders are nice when ya get to know em, but definitely won't take any shit.  Which in my experience is a pretty typical relationship with anyone Irish.  ;)
author: Justin G.

description: This my home away from home. Its kind of locals only spot thats why it rules hella hard.
author: Ali E.

description: Had my first date with my beau here. An awesome Irish bar. Spent St. Patrick's here recently. Great Fish & Chips. Great Caesar too. And Smithwick's. Pretty large inside.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Went here for Trivia Night on Wednesday. Fun stuff.
We had a larger party and I was sad to see they did not have tables to accommodate us all. We had to split into two teams. :(
The beers were good...and cheap.
We didn't eat but the food smelled AMAZING. Standard pub fare...
author: Maureen S.

description: If you're looking for a friendly, casual, neighborhood feeling bar, this is a good pick.  The drinks are reasonable, the food is good, the bar staff is friendly.  It's the kind of place that you may go to watch the game or just meet up with friends.  I love neighborhood bars like this.  If this was my neighborhood, I would hang out here.
author: Caitlin K.

description:
I never had a very good impression of this place because it's so over decorated on the outside. Maybe it's an OCD thing but looking at this place makes me jumpy. For that reason, and the abundance of bars I already know I like in the area, I've avoided this place.  Recently someone raved about the food so on my way home from getting my hair spiked I stepped in.

This is kind of a weird place. It's a smallish room with a giant bar in the middle and some tables and chairs crammed around it. If they had a smaller bar against the wall they could probably double the room for customers.

I ordered the full Irish breakfast for $12. For that kind of money I expected a big meal. They did their best to spread it all around the plate to make it look like more than it was but  it wasn't a very good value for the money.

I do like to people watch, the characters in this place tickled my inner Bukowski. Three stars for that alone!
author: Manny F.

description:
Came here to watch a Lakers playoff game but I promise this review wont be biased because I was upset at how poorly the Lakers played, thus left me leaving the bar unsatisfied. 

The place itself is small, but had lots of room at the bar and a ton of LCD TVs with various games on (baseball, basketball, soccer). Ordered two beers ($4.50 each I think). Food-wise got a basket of garlic parmesan fries. I know its bar food, but this was not the one! Fries sprinkled with a bit of garlic and shredded parm (which never got soft or melted) is not the way. Can they at least add some salt to it or something?! Also got the chicken fingers, which were actually pretty good. It wasn't breaded heavily and the chicken was crispy yet juicy..good job fryer! Finished off the Lakers loss with the Royal Burger, which I loved. Beef patty was juicy, and the fried sunny-side up egg topped it of perfectly (who doesn't love gooey egg yolk running down the burger and one's fingers whist eating?.. anyone?? well i do because eggs are amazing, especially on burgers. 

Friendly staff, friendly patrons, bonus stars for witnessing someone so drunk that he fell into the daily specials sign knocking both himself and the sign onto the floor while his friends pointed and laughed. Poor guy.
author: Pornsakdi T.

description: Stopped in here when I got in town on a Saturday and had to watch a UF football game. It wasn't incredibly crowded, but they were nice enough to turn the game on for me even though probably no one with the exception of one other person particularly wanted to watch it. Good (but not vast) beer selection, and nice neighborhood place. Not a lot of sports bars in the mission so this is a friendly and convenient spot.
author: Lauren C.

description:
First, this place is a Dive.  I mean that in the best sense of the word.

Husband and I have only been here for breakfast.  The food is diner style and quite a good value.  Their prices are more than fair, the bloody mary's good and the service friendly and efficient.  

We've not yet tried to cure a hangover here but I'm sure it's an outstanding place for hair of the dog.
author: Russell D.

description:
This place is pretty awesome.
I LOVE the trivia nights on Wednesday.
I LOVE their giant book of girly shots/drinks.
I LOVE the fact that you can eat and play pool in the same room.
However, I don't like their breakfast menu!  It's very limited and the eggs benedict just tasted funny.  I'm not sure what it was, but it wasn't very tasty.
However, I have tried their specials, the shepherds pie, the fish and chips, and everything else is pretty spot on.
This place is mostly a good place to pre-party before you head off to other bars.
author: Meh M.

description:
I mean where else can you get a good- nasty snarl from a real Irish bartender? Not just an authentic one, but kind of in a arrggg pirate "walk the plank" or I'll knife you...yeah nothin' says true warmth and welcome like a ship-wrecker. Well honestly that's why I'm moving out of this neighborhood: no decent bars and the crime among other things. Now that I'll be far away, I can finally write this review without the fear of being captured and beaten by the motley crew that frequents here. 

Everytime I've needed another drink I've literally had to do the YMCA to get the attention of a certain *cough* bartender who seems to be suffering a bad case of scurvy on the regular. The real gem though is the look of utter disdain when you get your very small and over-priced drink. 

Now I've given it 2 stars, so let's look on the up-side. There is a pool table, they serve real food (not that I've tried it) and the back wooden booths can actually be nice for a decent conversation with a friend or a date. In my (old) hood this was as good as it got within my radius...AND I do like an Irish accent.
author: NaNa M.

description: Didn't spend too much time at this pub, but it had a great feel inside; warm and friendly. The people there are your average joe, no shows or meat markets here. Grab some good cheap drinks, catch up with old friends, and let the good times roll.
author: John S.

description: I'm writing a review because this bar is underrated. The bartender tonight, (Sunday), was Emma. Emma was terrific and nice. I walked up to the bar and she got me a drink immediately. This happened four or five times. She was friendly and welcoming. The drinks were inexpensive. They have drinks that are 4.75 and such, but so does Clooney's, so similar pricing structure. I like to just leave the quarters with the tip. But, the point is, they have a good on-tap selection, the bartender is friendly, they have space, and there was nobody that was too rough for the go. Napper Tandy is like a nice, middle-working class bar without hipsters or people that are actually dangerous when they're drunk. I liked it here. They treated me well and they gave me good drinks.
author: Sergi A.

description:
I lived by this place for a few years after it opened and never went in. Boy was I missing out on good breakfasts!!! Went for the first time a couple weeks ago on a Friday night and had a good time playing pool, drinking, and meeting new friends.
I had such a good time, I accidentally left my hat. I ended up calling them after 2am and thankfully, they found it. I went in hungover the next morning to pick it up and stayed for some corned beef hash and eggs. IT WAS DELICIOUS!!! I am definitely going back for breakfast if I'm in that neck of the woods again.
author: N. L.

description: Very delicious. Their guinness stew was one of the best I've had, and my friend's pesto chicken sandwich was very juicy and delicious. The server was very friendly as well. This restaurant also regularly puts out discounts on restaurant.com and livingsocial, so its worth checking out for awesome eats.
author: Angela V.

description:
Satisfactory location to watch soccer matches.

Plus: Had US v Algeria and England v Slovenia showing on adjacent televisions. Small thing, but tells me they know what they're doing.

Plus: Standing room only for US v Algeria this morning.
Minus: Quiet crowd. I'm a big introvert, and when I'm the one initiating clapping or cheering, that tells me something about the other people watching.

Plus: Have a real Irish breakfast. Surprisingly hard to find. I love me that perfect fork-full of sausage, baked beans, black pudding, egg yolk, and fried tomato
Minus: I think I was the only one who ordered it. Other people ordering eggs florentine--I'm sure it was good, but really? in an Irish pub?

Plus: Nice people, friendly pub.

Take-home: Quite a fine place for a drink and pub meal. Not sure that this will be my go-to pub for future soccer matches.
author: Derrick L.

description:
+2 stars for beers just the way I like 'em - lager of some kind w/ lime - thanks gals.

+2 stars for fun trivia night wackiness.  A total treat.

Also: it's Boston-y!
author: Mark S. I.

description:
Oh the Napper :-)

Been here TONS of times and have had a blast every single time. Some good friends of mine live close so it used to be our after work spot, we quickly became good friends with the staff (celebrated New Years Eve with them) and then the Napper became a regular spot for my boyfriend and I to watch Sunday football. 

The foods good, the service is friendly. All around great place.
author: Elise C.

description:
Alright so most of my socialization last year was going out after work to bars (or during lunch).  This place happened a few times because it was close enough to where we worked (Excelsior/Outer Mission) and it is tasty!

This place has great food for decent prices as well as great drink specials all the time.  It's been crazy busy a few times, and a few others it's been dead, so it's really about if you love the crowd or not.

Indoor and outdoor seating a plus, small bathroom a minus.

Also I know a bartendress there.  She rocks!  But there is another female bartender/server that is just rude.  She has an Irish accent I believe.  I don't know why she is always just rude or seemingly hates her job.
author: Xhris C.

description: I've only been here for trivia night and it's always tons of fun (even if we don't win).  Anyone interested in joining the team? :) The food isn't great, but I will say that their wings are pretty decent, though you basically need to inhale them for them to be good.  Once they've been sitting around for 3 minutes or so, they lose their magic, so be warned.  There's a petite bartender there I really like because she rocked when she had to kick out a drunk 6-foot+ man out of the bar for smoking inside.  Tip her well.  I think her name is Sherry (?).
author: Terri M.

description:
The food is decent enough pub grub, but the service is atrocious. The TVs are small and too high to watch them.

Everything takes forever: ordering drinks, getting them, getting menus, ordering food, getting the food, etc. Unbelievably, after the waitress dropped off our food, she just split for the evening! None of the other staff followed up, and after sitting there for the 30 minutes it took us to figure that out, we had to go to the bar to fetch and pay our bill. Ridiculous.
author: Adam Z.

description:
This is a small Irish bar with no happy hour, mediocre service, and INCREDIBLY DELICIOUS FRENCH FRIES, predominately patronized by Mexicans and assorted Mission sketchballs.

And a pair of friends: one respectable-looking dude with a laptop case in business attire (that would be my buddy Don), and his tired, dirty, just-moved-in-and-can't-find-any-clean-clothes-and-hungover-from-Latin-American-Club-Margaritas companion (that would be me).

Seriously, this place is not big. There's a room with billiards adjoining the bar itself, but it feels like a separate bar altogether. And the waitresses will NOT be very interested in you. Or, at least they weren't interested in us. And we're interesting, damnit! They were more interested in practicing their Irish-Spanish with the dudes on the other side of the bar. 

However, I believe this DID lead to either an intentional or unintentional deduction of one beer off our tab. So that's a big plus. I hate small talk anyway.

And they did, however, bring me the aforementioned MOST DELICIOUS FRENCH FRIES ON THIS EARTH. Did I mention I was hungover from the Latin? 

Oh, you've never had a margarita at the Latin?

I HAD TWO. GO ATTEMPT THAT FEAT AND SEE IF YOU EVER OPEN YOUR EYES AGAIN.

So yeah, I ordered me some french fries. And holy crap, they are GOOD.

So all that said, I'll probably be back. Don and I will be resurrecting our after-work drinks, now that we're neighbors, and this will be a good, quiet spot, where we can be more or less ignored by the staff, entertained by sketchballs, and cure any shameful weekday hangovers with delicious assorted friend items for dipping.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Well, I don't know if this is as good as it gets, but damn it does come close.

The service is spot on. Lisa and Amanda (the only ones I've met) are always smiling, friendly, and do they have a sharp memory!

Happy hour is awesome. I forget when it starts (I think 3pm) til 7pm.  
Every day there's a different theme to the day:

Monday
All you can eat Fish n Chips
$3 Heineken and Amstel
 
Tuesday
1/2 price wine and champagne  

Wednesday
Brainstormer Pub Quiz  

Thursday
Open Mic - Yeah, scarey.

Friday
After Work Happy Hour!  

Saturday
Breakfast
Karaoke Night  

Sunday
Breakfast
Jazz @ 12:30  

The prices low and portions are never EVER short changed.  Did I say their food is decent?  Also, that Lisa and Amanda are AWESOME!!!

The clientele is mature.  I've never felt uncomfortable in this place... unlike the bar down the street... but that's another review.

I'm telling you this is the west coast version of "Cheers".
author: Herman P.

description:
You know it's going to be a rough night when you have to have a shot BEFORE you go to the bar.

Such was the case yesterday when my Manders & I popped into The Napper Tandy before hitting DYL.

Despite this establishment being mere blocks from my abode, I'd never been there before last evening...

Now I know why:

$12 for two lemondrop shots, which took the bartender 10 minutes to make...

She had to call in help from a more experienced bartender.

Not good.

Hint to bars: don't schedule new bartenders who don't know what the fuck they're doing for a Friday night at Happy Hour time.

Poor choice, Napper Tandy - doubt I'll be back.
author: Kate R.

description:
I went to the Napper Tandy to meet a crew of new friends on a Wednesday night.  It is definitely a neighborhood bar with some interesting character.  It's got a laid-back crowd, with cheap drinks.  I'd recommend coming here just to see what you might see...

First, it was quiz night.  There was a lady with a thick accent announcing borderline unintelligible questions/answers out of the PA that reached all of this very small bar.  Second, there's this odd thing about people bringing in donuts from the late-night donut shop from across the street.  Third, there's this random cool little dog running around the bar like he owns the place.   Fourth, I had heard a story here about some guy "shirt-cocking" out of the bar during the day - he dropped his pants and walked out and about, with nothing but a shirt on over his junk.  And to make matters more strange, this dude was part of the group I was hanging out with.  

Yes, it's a strange would we live in, and the Mission seems to own the lion's share of this strangeness.  And if you would like to witness this while having a drink, come to Napper Tandy.
author: Leo C.

description:
5 Stars for the Onion Rings...seriously the best I have EVER had. The guy sitting next to us ordered a "side" (full plate portion) of Onion Rings..when they emerged from the kitchen the entire bar was drooling. They are the size of donuts and are pure perfection!!

The bar itself seems pretty chill...but the ONION RINGS!!!! Seriously I think I dreamt about them last night...
author: Wendy W.

description:
"Snapper Tranny?, Natty tapper?, Clap or Candy?" huh?

I walked down 24th and saw a sign dawning "The Napper Tandy" moniker and the above cell phone conversation made sense.

I met up with a friend here; upon arrival I was slapped in the face with what seemed to be the smell of 100 year old puke  (however, I'm a serious fan of dive bars so, I was not deterred).

This place has a lot going for it but, here I will use my trusty bullet points to sum up the pros and cons:

Pros:
~Real honest to gosh Irish accents in the Mission
~Irish-Mex...livin' in harmony dynamic
~Newcastle on tap...niiice
~Dinner at the bar (i'm turning into my G-Pa)
~Nice pub feel

Cons:
~Afore mentioned puke smell
~Chicken in the Chicken curry is just weird
~Dumb-Ass name

3 pros + 3 cons= 3 stars
nice math
author: R M.

description:
This is a weird place to do karakoe. They have a big comfortable room in back that would be perfect, but there's a pool table in it. I'm sorry, but I don't give a feck for pool. When I was a kid I was shite at sports, but I was pretty good at playing Galaga and Rolling Thunder at the 7-Eleven. Now I'm a Karaoke Matador who sucks at pool.

Anyhow, bar-wise this is just a place. If Glenny (the full-contact KJ of Amnesia and Lingba) didn't do karaoke here, I likely wouldn't be reviewing it at all, as essentially it's The Phoenix or Liberties, only in a grubbier location. Same Faux Oirishness, same beerses, same-ish greazy pub grub.

But back to karaoke. Because it's off the beaten track I got to sing like 5 songs last night. Awesome. One Mic Whore, present and accounted for. But why did that nice girl sing Good Charlotte last night? How did that seem like a good idea? Lifestyles Of The Crappiest Music.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
I have to knock a couple of stars because I live nearby. Normally this would be a plus except that sometimes on weekdays I would hear a guy singing one of those depressing-  I just got dumped songs over and over and over again. This really sucks when you have to wake up at 4:30 in the fucking morning to open up a coffee shop. Thankfully that was ages ago and I don't need to worry about that anymore, but it was such a pain in the ass to only squeeze in 2 hours of sleep on a weekday, you know.
 
Decent cocktails, better than average beer selection, and the burgers and some of the specials are good too. Fun place to play pool, as for brunch I have yet to go but seems like it's worth checking out. Owners are super friendly, they always say hi or smile when I pass by. Overall nice neighborhood spot.
author: X marks the spot ..

description: This is a great Irish pub.  I come here primarily for the Wednesday trivia night, but I would stop by for a drink another time.  The waitresses are all really friendly and accommodating.  They always have some great drink specials so be sure to ask!  One thing, I wish the trivia went a little faster because sometimes it goes until almost midnight which is much longer than most other trivia places.
author: Marin G.

description:
I wanted to like this place since I live in the neighborhood. They pour a good Guinness and I thought the bartender was nice. I went with a friend to have fish and chips, but that soon changed. 
We saw a employee who was cooking the food use the bathroom and not wash their hands. YUK!

I cook for a living, and not washing your hands after using the bathroom is a no no. Look everyone has a busy life but it only takes 1 minute to wash up. 
Sorry Napper Tandy. I still might go for a beer but not the food.
author: krispy k.

description: After driving around for a long time.. Decided to stop here... Homestyle apple bees as my buddy calls it. I'm starving and.. Its been 30 mins.. NO FOOD.. Really it takes that long to fried 3 piece of chicken tenders!!! Overall, I do not miss this place one bit, unless they hire more folks, and stop working the poor waitress all by herself serving a crowd of 30+, front and back room!
author: Monika T.

description:
33% Irish Pub, 33% Sports Bar, 33% Mission Dive, 100% good times. I watch football here on Sundays and the staff could not be any more accomodating or charming (especially when you have the sunday morning hangover blues). It's family owned and operated with tons of regulars (mostly young ex-pat Irish fellas in tow with their adoring groupies. Old school blue collar mission blokes too).

Glen, the dude who runs karaoke on saturday nights is the most fun energetic motherf*&^ker on the planet. Plus, he's got a cowbell. I really need to get one of those.
author: John T.

description: I went here for 3 world cup games. The first two experiences were great --after today I will never go back, especially since there are tons of other great places to watch matches. Outside they posted $20 minimum for a table--fair enough. What was not clear was that they expected everyone to buy $20 of drinks (but did not enforce it with tickets etc) even if you were standing watching the game. We had a few drinks yet were continually rudely being told we had to buy more and more--they might as well have come to us every three minutes and told us to give them more money like beggars--it completely ruined the experience for me. So I left and watched the rest of the game elsewhere where I continued to get more drinks that this time were not being thrust down my throat.
author: John D.

description: Went there 8-6-11 about 8pm'ish with kendo on karaoke.  I met some regulars last saturday, they're cool and I spoke with them.  Definitely enjoy myself belting out my tunes:  1) just the way you are by billy joel, 2) honesty by billy joel, 3) let's groove: earth wind+fire(this one regular joined me in this song), + 4)for the longest time: billy joel.  I'm glad folks actually enjoy listening to me sing along wih others.  I had a mgd($3, it's cheap, but didn't really enjoy the flavor)---followed by fat tire,new castle+hefewezein beers. This bar allows dogs into the establishment, which one patron brought in
author: Jer W.

description:
Meh, this place is alright. I've only been here twice, both times because my buddy Tom lives a couple blocks away from it. 
The beer selection's pretty thin, but the barstaff are cool, and will make you all sorts of weird drinks if you ask, like the Orange Tic-Tac, which I think contains orange liqueur of some kind plus vodka and Red Bull. It sure tasted like a orange Tic-Tac, but made me feel sorta queasy afterwards, like Red Bull usually does. 
They also have a pool table hidden in the back room, but I have never played on it.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Went into the Napper Tandy for the first time last night.   Walking in, it's your typical Mission dive bar.  I like dive bars, so I thought I'd really enjoy this place, and it's close to my house.  Not so much.  It's not the place, or the energy, or the specials (which are great by the way!  Monday night all you can eat fish & chips / and $9 pitchers of Bud Light), no it's none of those things....it's the staff.  

It could have just been an off night, but both the chicks behind the bar had sour looks on their faces and wouldn't even bother to serve me - preferring instead to wait on every guy at the bar and not even looking in my direction.  I understand that men generally tip female bar staff better, but maybe it's because you ignore your female patrons.  Ever thought of that, geniuses?  

It wasn't until my boyfriend went up to the bar that they paid attention.  Again, the only reason to go here is the specials, and while the fish and chips were good, and they had sports on all the tv's, the attitudes of the bar staff are really not worth enduring - oh, and don't go in without a guy - lest you die of dehydration before getting a drink.
author: Alison L.

description:
You know how everyone feels the need to rep where they're from?  Are you East Coast like P Diddy or West Coast like Snoop Dogg?  East Bay holdin' it down, or livin' large on the Peninsula?

Well Lil MC Mar here layin it down 4 realz.  i been all up in the Napper Tandy 'hood for days and i ain't playin when i tell u s'alright.  Fo sho they gots the full bar, TVs, pool... but ain't that special.

4 hella days i got the feelin that i gots 2 get Tandy's back just cuz we in the same hood and all.  My homies swear by it, but i really think they just talk it up cuz its real close, ya heard?  But ya know i tell u what Yelp done been more family 2 me than the Tandy ever been and i gots to 2 b true 2 my real relations, fo sho.  Tandy ain't bad, i been there sumtimes, but it ain't no big deal.

Maybe on a quieter night I'll enjoy a small gin and tonic with a squeeze of cranberry with my associates, however I wouldn't recommend it to an out-of-towner.  Period.
author: Mari C.

description:
fun fun fun! wed. trivia night is a blast- bring a well rounded team and you'll have a great time.

i didn't love my food, but it was good enough and the drinks were brought to us by a friendly and attentive waitress. even when we were picky, she was nice.

i probably wouldn't go here for a mean but i'll definitely be back for trivia night and vodka tonics.
author: Nikki C.

description: Great ambience. Very cool bartender. Fish and Chips were awesome. Wish I had tried the bangers and mash or the shepherd's pie. Nice little spot. And they pour Guinness the proper way.
author: Michael S.

description:
Despite the recommendation from my friend that Phonebooth was the trendier choice (where, he noted, he saw Drew Barrymore the week before), we made our way north to Napper Tandy.  

Surveying it from the entrance, I liked the layout of the place -- a large central bar surrounded on all sides by seating, with a cluster of high tables flanking the window to the right of the entrance.  At the back, there appeared a small gnomish opening--the type you might use to enter John Malkovich's head--which led to a secret back room containing billiards and more seating.

It was about a half hour before the last BART on a saturday when we happened on this place, and it was only about half full.  I don't know if this is an aberration, but its just the way I like it.  Enough room to sit down and relax, but not empty enough to hear crickets.

While the selection of beers on tap wasn't phenomenal, you really only need one to get you though any particular night. 

This is definitely the place to go with friends from out of town who you'd like to converse with, since you can actually hear yourself think (careful, that inner voice might be John Cusack in there...)
author: LJ W.

description: I really dig this place.  It's really cozy and the bar ends up taking up most of the room.  I like how there's a lot of tables in the back as well so it's good to chill with a group of people.  A few years back they had karaoke there and it was awesome.
author: Mitch A.

description: Napper Tandy contacted me regarding the misunderstanding with the Sweetjacks deal.  They let me know they had a $25 voucher for food with my name on it.  Last night my sister and I went to have fish n' chips and sure enough there was an envelope under the counter with my name on it!  The fish n' chips were very good.  Definitely going back to try out breakfast and other items on the menu.
author: Etta L.

description:
Back in 85 my neighbors had a Tandy PC and it was off the hook. I completely destroyed everyone at the surfing competition in California Games.

I don't think they made Tapper for the Tandy PC though, which is unfortunate because Tapper is an occasionally accurate representation of The Napper Tandy, broken glasses and bar fights and all. (It's really pretty chill most of the time. I just couldn' t tie the Tapper reference up any other way.)

There's food too. The fish & chips are about as greasily tasty as deep fried fish and potatoes are supposed to be, and I imagine the fish tacos are decent too since they appear to be the same pieces of battered fish on tortillas instead of french fries. Portions are generous and reasonably priced, and the service is friendly.

The bathroom line at the Napper Tandy is one of the few places in the world where you can overhear a drunk Englishman and a drunk Mexican man debate the relative merits of Manchester United and Chivas USA.

It turns out that it's actually named after James Napper Tandy, a 19th century irish politician and activist rather than the Radio Shack PCs from the 80s. Tapper was still pretty awesome anyway.
author: matthew r.

description:
ever seen a 5 foot tall woman bartender kick a one legged man out of the bar for being a complete d*ck? i have, and it was awesome.

the food looked great, but i was too late to get any myself. i'll be back.
author: Ameer N.

description: I am starting to dig this place! The first time I came here was for Karaoke night and it was a big surprise to all of us that showed up, and we had a blast! Very cheap well-drinks & beer.  Get there early to enjoy their happy hour menu & hang out with friends.  The bartenders are very friendly and have irish accents!!! I love this place especially their fish & chips (you need to check them out).  And if there's Magners that makes me a happy camper :)
author: Jessica H.

description:
Sure, it looks kinda lame on the outside but trust me, its much cooler once you're through the doors.  I recently made the Napper Tandy the last stop on my birthday bar crawl on 24th Street.  I had my doubts (i.e. I thought it might be a lame Irish pub with a bunch of dudes wearing button-down shirts and eating bad nachos) but I included it on my crawl because it has karaoke and I figured it'd be a fun way to end the night.

In our case, fun was an understatement.

The karaoke is totally low-key, unassuming and generally awesome (no stage, small space).  The crowd immediately accepted my gang of drunk newbies and tons of compliments were exchanged after each performer.  I rarely do karaoke because I know I'm a lousy singer and I don't want to embarrass myself, but I felt comfortable enough to sing here and I'm pretty sure the crowd enjoyed my rendition of "Total Eclipse of the Heart" (it's a pretty fabulous song, no?).  I told the karaoke DJ it was my birthday to ensure I'd get a shot to sing-- not only did I get my chance but the whole bar sang "Happy Birthday" to me afterwards.  It was a blast!

Great song selection and the peeps who were there had super good taste in songs-- almost every choice was a winner (and by winner, I mean the whole bar sang along and cheered).

I'm relatively new to the city and I fully intend on becoming a regular at the Napper Tandy.  Come check it out-- we'll do a duet!
author: Kristin P.

description:
Its Monday night post a brutal soccer match. You're sweaty, you're hungry, and all you really want is Guinness.  Welcome to the Napper Tandy.   Cheap Bar food, great drinks, and a nice little jukebox.

And the best part?  Lorina.   She pours a perfect guinness, she's fast, attentive, and doesn't screw up orders.   And right when you take that last sip, she is there asking you if you want another.  Yea, she pretty much rules.  

The Napper isn't fancy, it isn't snooty, but its perfect.   And 5 Guinness's later I oft wonder how I managed to get toasty, once again, on a Monday Night.   I'll thank Lorina for that one!
author: Susan C.

description:
I was a Phone Booth devotee until I discovered the Napper Tandy, now my half of my heart (and liver) belongs to the Nappers. 

Bartenders are super friendly (Bill and Lisa are my favorites), drinks are good (Grey Goose Sea Breeze), fantastic jukebox and the crowd is super nice. I don't do pub quiz or karaoke, I visit the bar to drink and hang out, but it is nice to know I have options!
author: Anabelle B.

description:
I stumbled into Napper Tandy at 9:30 a.m. one September Sunday morning, looking to watch some NFL in the Mission. I haven't missed a Sunday since.

I really like the location of the Napper Tandy. It's located one block from the 24th St. BART station, and only about 7 or 8 blocks from where I live, so it's a nice walk.

The restaurant and pub are owned by Marissa, who is from Ireland. Her sister Danielle reached out to me the first time I went there, and now she is one of the reasons I go every Sunday.

Not only are their drinks good, but they have amazing food. Guilded bangers and mash anyone?

I am pretty new to Yelp, so I am not sure how these reviews go, but I would recommend Napper Tandy to anyone who wants to just relax on a weekend, watch some football, shoot some pool, and eat some bangin food.

My friends and I even started an Irish breakfast club in the back room.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I was originally going to give the Napper 2 stars, but I thought I would go with the flow. 

Let me begin by saying that the 2 stars is no reflection on the Napper itself but on the area its in. I know, I know you hipsters are probably writing me off right now, but you can all go to hell. I lived at the corner of 24th and shotwell for over a year, so I am not some uniformed yuppy who cant handle a little flavor. 

The Napper was a block away from my house at the time and my roomates and I drank here often. It was the perfect place to chill and do some serious drinking during the week, with a mixed bar crowd. 

I basically just got tired of the crappy walk back home.
author: Tom V.

description: Cool bar- definitely a neighboorhood spot. I could tell it was almost 99% regulars in the place. NO idea they had food here, as couple guys actually brought in a couple burritos.
author: Jim B.

description:
Im still laughing about one of the reviews of this place..  the fact that they had to pay for the food, very funny... I haven't explored the menu, i just saw a sign on the wall saying all you can eat.. the thing is, maybe i'm a sucker for fish and chips.. but i liked em... maybe it was because on Monday nights (the only time i have eaten there, drank there many times) its all you can eat for 10 bucks...

Really nice staff, crazy weird customers, that tend to sway back n forth from here and Treat street.
author: Rachel L.

description:
The best way I can describe the Napper Tandy is that it's a Lower East Side Manhattan hipster karaoke pub crammed into San Francisco's Mission District.

Okay, admittedly that has a lot to do with the fact that you're literally ALWAYS in somebody's way when you're at the Napper Tandy. If someone wants to get to the bathroom, the whole place has to reshuffle. If someone wants to order a drink, the whole place has to shift & grind to accommodate. Basically, it's a place meant for regulars & small crowds.

Still, despite the intense crowdedness, the karaoke was FUN & the crowd was having a blast.

Oh yeah, & minus one more star for high drink prices. Seriously, three shots of Wild Turkey & a vodka tonic for $22 at a dive bar?! Gimme a break.
author: Pete J.

description:
The Napper Tandy, the Napper Tandy, the Napper Tandy...

I heard of this place a few times on some yelp threads and I keep thinking to myself "I heard of this place before"

I finally search for it and I'm like "I BEEN HERE!!!  I FINALLY HAVE A PLACE TO FUCKIN REVIEW"

And here it is:

It's a nice place in the Mission district, with a very nice atmosphere, nicely priced alcohol, and lots of seating.

The bartender that I had was very efficient, and got my order perfectly correct even though I made a few mistakes while ordering like 5 drinks...

It has a nice vibe to it and I enjoyed the few hours I was there with some co-workers.

Enjoy!!
author: Mike V.

description: I recently visited The Napper Tandy during a SF DYL.  I enjoyed the excellent table service from our hard working waitress.  The mojitos were delicious, as were the bacon cheddar cheese fries.  I must complain about the layout of the bar and its many enclaves.  Furniture could be placed better.  Our Yelp swarm overwhelmed the sporty room in the back, further complicating the already small area.  I left without saying goodbye because I just felt trapped.
author: Camille K.

description:
My Home away from home. I frequently stop in here after work. sometimes I'll bring work into the back room, you know a satellite office. I wish there was a 4.5 because it's not the best bar in the planet. But it's accessible, easy to find, and serves alcohol -- don't get no better than that!

You will find me here 4-5 days a week, enjoying the SF life.

EDIT: I spent last night drinking at the Tandy, and was allowed to commander the back room to watch 24. No. Seriously. I was allowed to watch 24, whiskey and pool stick in hand. It was awesome. 4.5 stars no more, this place deserves all 5. Yelp will have to go to 6 stars if they start serving Jack Bauer Shots (50/50 mix of gasoline and whiskey). Awesome.
author: Tyler W.

description:
Three stars for the Napper Tandy itself.  But this place has Pub Quiz (Wednesday nights) and Pub Quiz means an automatic extra star.  While my team has yet to win a Pub Quiz, it's a great (and cheap) form of entertainment, especially if you're a bunch of Caltech grads who think they know everything but always get boned by the dreaded Sports Round.

Haven't been for Karaoke, but given the jukebox selection, it doesn't surprise me that hilarity would ensue.

Also, props for having an island bar (well, ok, a peninsula bar).
author: Wes M.

description:
I feel like a stranger in a strange land when I go here, but I keep coming back. Very pleasant and somewhat matronly bartenders with accents, but my hot tottie was infested with roughly 50 whole cloves. The food is blah, but sometimes you want blah. Try the shepherd's pie. Why not? It's easy to feel depressed here. 
Wendesday night is trivia night, filled with dweebs, geeks, and weirdos, but I can't come down too hard because my team came in last.  Waiting for rematch.
author: Caitlin P.

description: Unfortunately, I wasn't able to review the food or drinks because as soon as my friend and I walked in the bartender was more than rude. She didn't greet us when we came in she just glared at us and didn't even get up off the stool she was sitting on to help us. we were just taking in the seemingly fun atmosphere when, before we sat, the bartender said " before you two even sit down, I need to see your i.d.s, don't get too comfortable." That did it for me, we just walked out and left, that was a Sunday night, maybe someday I will try again but certainly not a Sunday.
author: Jamie P.

description: Good location, crowd and atmosphere, mediocre food and great service.  Happy hour specials are solid and Sheri will take very good care of you.
author: Quinn S.

description: Outstanding beef stew. Good beer special. Wifi sucks but that's not what I came for.
author: t k.

description: This is the best place to come for football Sunday! Great food, drinks and staff. The bartenders are always so personable and cheerful. We love coming here! They play all the games and have a ton of tv's to view games from. They have raffles with prizes after the morning and afternoon game. We always feel welcomed when we come. Like I said, it's the best place to go on a Sunday. It has the best of everything!
author: Kelly R.

description:
Sunday morning and the wait at St. Francis down the street was already ridiculous. Hungry as hell. $20 in my wallet, so Slow Club or Universal Cafe was also out of the price range. 

Payday not for another week. 

Where do I go?  The fucking Napper Tandy, that's where. Before 12pm on Sundays, you can get a variety of awesome breakfasts for $5 (I got eggs, potatoes, bacon, and toast for $5. seriously.), and one of their pretty damn tasty Bloody Marys (which they make with a shot of Guinness here by the way... totally fitting for an Irish pub) for another $5. On top of that, if you order a $5 breakfast, you can add on a Mimosa for just $3 more. I got all of the above.

Total bill? $13. And I was buzzed too. So good.
author: George C.

description:
The service tends to be terrible (dirty dishes and glasses take forever to get cleared), the food is mediocre and overpriced, and every piece of furniture in the place (booths, barstools, tables) is somehow just a little bit uncomfortable.

The upside is that this is the one place where I have actually won a pub quiz / trivia night.  Not because my teams are good, mind you, but because the braniacs who show up to places like Mad Dog in the Fog and kick my moderately-informed ass week after week have left the Napper Tandy alone.  If you want to get drunk somewhere and still feel smarter when you leave, this place is worth a try.
author: Paul B.

description:
I love the Napper Tandy. I discovered it walking home after work from the 22nd St. CalTrain Station. I had just climbed Potrero Hill under the horrible sun and suddenly  I started fantasizing about a sexy big cold Guinness. You know what they say: once you go black... 

Anyway, there I was, thinking about this heavenly liquid pouring into my throat from a big glass pint with condensed water droplets around it and, suddenly, I saw it: The Napper Tandy,  with a neon Guinness sign on the facade. 

I think that the lovely Irish waiter realized my liquid cravings at first sight, and rapidly asked me: Cold beer sir? My "yess" was probably intimidating and obscene.

Anyway, since that day, I cannot resist the temptation of hoping out the 24th bus and getting a Guinness and a snack before going home. And every single time I go I find myself mingling with an Irish crowd (love Irish people) and being very well treated by the Irish sisters behind the bar.

I am spoiled and like to be treated well when I am hungry and thirsty. 

I haven't tested it during drinking mode, so the rating is for how perfectly The Napper Tandy works  for me when I want a beer and something to it on my way home. 

 Long live the Napper.
author: Jorge B.

description: Came here last night because my friend was hungry and I was thirsty.  There was a good crowd on Sunday evening, but it wasn't too crowded.  Ordered a mimosa and it was heavy on the champagne AND cheap at $5.  Good mix of music playing.
author: Marie B.

description:
Wow! Can't believe I didn't review this place before.
My favorite local bar. Wednesday night trivia is pretty sweet (once you get used to Marissa's accent). The bartenders are amazing. Sometimes, the food is a little slow (the kitchen gets backed up when it's crowded). They have typical American food and some Irish dishes (Bangers and Mash, blood sausages, you know).
This is a really great place to be! Oh, and they have drink specials every night.
author: Meghan B.

description:
Since the demise of my favorite corner bar, the Napper Tandy is rapidly becoming one of my favorite hangouts. The staff is always friendly and  courteous. The customers are friendly, and I've always felt comfortable striking up a conversation with the person next to me. Best of all - they have Boddington's on tap! 

I've eaten here several times, and have always enjoyed the food. They have a new menu, which I haven't sampled, but plan to in the near future.
author: Lucky G.

description: Good vibe, good horse shoe shaped bar, friendly girls bartending, like Cheers where everybody knows your name.  A few hipsters sometimes sashay in here with their smirks and waxed moustaches, but mostly it's normal people, local folks, day laborers and UK ex-pats.  Many TVs with sports on, great beers, and sometimes they'll play your ipod on shuffle for the whole bar.  Pretty cool.  Their food might be their best feature, just tonight I had a killer reuben with thick chunks of corned beef and nice crispy fries.  I'd avoid their burgers because they're frozen patties not worthy of the rest of this awesome pub food menu.  I dare say, even better than the other local irish sports pub with great food, the Phoenix.  Plus I enjoy sipping my Smithwicks and watching all the dum dums meandering down 24th street outside.  Napper wins!
author: Evan K.

description:
Woo hoo quiz night!

I'm only here for that, racking my brain with an ever-changing cast of cohorts.  We're in the back of the pub near the pool table, crammed into a booth, eating various fried foods, downing beer and screaming whenever we get a wrong answer.

Our team did place 2nd once, though, and we split the bottle of wine we won.  It's such a good time, and the friendly staff at Napper Tandy always helps things run smoothly.  Our table service has always been top notch, and you can't beat the $5 drink specials.  Since this place is so close to BART I don't fret the trek back to my part of the city.
author: Charlotte M.

description:
came here for trivia night... irish pubs arent my usual thing, but i truly enjoyed my fat tire and garlic fries here

cool, chill neighborhood friendly place.
author: J C.

description: I like drinking beer in its branded glass. Silly, I know. They have the fancy Modelo glasses here. $4.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
First, I met my girlfriend here while having drinks with friends. 
Second, I think they have reasonably good food considering that it's a pub (and I've heard magnificent stories about their shepherd's pie).
Third, they have Boddington's.
Fourth, it's the place where a giant guy with a Giants jersey came out of the bathroom being sorry for the giant stinkage left in the bathroom. 
Quintessential San Francisco, no?
author: Dario B.

description: Love the quiz night! WIll definitely be back ---and the foods not terrible too. Yummy fried pub food.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Hung out at the Napper Tandy for many World Cup games. The staff was really friendly and the atmosphere is super chill. Great food, had bfast and then the burger and fries and it was all killer! I will def be back for that burger!
author: Gretchen S.

description: friday night a friend suggested we head over to this pub and grab some drinks, food and the warriors game. we headed for a booth in the back with a clear view of one of several large tv's that litter this place. the waitress was EXTREMELY nice when i asked if it was possible to turn the game on and immediately changed the channel for me. reasonably prices beers/shots (we drank guinness, coors light and jamie) the food was probably the best bar food ive ever had. the bacon/blue cheese/onion string burger was phenomenal. we split a plate of disco fries. i am not a fan of gravy in general, but man, those were some good fries. my friend had fish and chips, which he had my try and they were also really really good. the two waitresses on staff that evening were attentive, quick and very friendly. all in all, i would certainly return.
author: Mary B.

description:
I live 2 blocks away.

Believe everything you read since your experience will vary based on a bunch of factors -- day/night, staff, cook, regulars, gangsters, current sports.

All in all, its the greatest bar at 24th and South Van Ness -- for normal people.
author: Simon S.

description: Great Irish bar with good drink prices (and specials), and the bartenders and patrons make great company. I had the fish and chips, which was solid. I live around the area and plan to visit regularly.
author: Yasser A.

description:
What a great bar!

We came in at 8:30 for 8:30 trivia and there were no tables available. The owner found a table for us from the basement and set us up! I don't know if I've ever experienced that much service before! Food was good, and a pitcher of beer was $12; there were also $3 beer specials.
author: Jay T.

description: My friends and I live around the corner, and frequent the pub for a quick round of drinks or crawl back the next morning for $5 breakfast.  Friendly service and a mellow local crowd make this a solid neighborhood choice.
author: Nick H.

description:
Shouts out to the Napper!

One of the main reasons my soccer team and I go to the Napper is because of Lorina.  She's a cool ass chick that gets along with the best of them. I give her praise for she puts up with a lot of idiots and crap at the bar, and yet doesn't let it bother her.

She loves that we harass her with our cheer and chants upon entering and leaving every Monday night.  She knows our drinks and the food we eat.  Shoot, we should call her Mum for she takes such good care of us.

The Napper is the real deal and Lorina just adds to the spice of the place!
author: Piper C.

description: This place kicks ass.  A definite mish-mosh of pure Irish drinking, hospitality and food combined with some Mission flavor.  Also, the place always gets pretty decked out for holidays, so it gives Napper's a real homey feel.  The Bartenders are great as well all, they keep it real but have a gentle soul.
author: Scott R.

description: Watched USA vs Ghana here with the Napper Tandy filled to the brim.  I give the service by the bartender that morning 5 stars.  Very attentive and quick when we placed our orders.  The reason I give this place only 3 stars is the TV quality was a little fuzzy when watching the game and the food was just ok pub food (we had chicken tenders and potato skins).  For me it defeats the purpose of going to a pub and watching a sports match if the quality is not as good or better than my home system.  I'll have to check out the vibe on a typical night to see if I can upgrade my rating.
author: Brian A.

description: Walking home from a Glen Hansard/Marketa Irglova/Frames gig, a friend and myself got off the BART at 24th and Mission and happened upon this place accidentally.  Irish accents were tumbling out of the doorways, and salsa music played on the overhead speakers, a strange and lovely mix, and totally appropriate for the Mission.  I ordered a Guiness and Bailey's, and the bartender was warm and friendly, and even bought us a round of drinks-- I loved everything about this place, and would recommend it to anyone. :)
author: olga n.

description: This is a really nice place. The staff are great, very friendly. Food is good. Not very busy on a Saturday night, kinda quiet.
author: Megan K.

description: LEGITIMATE IRISH ACCENTS AND FULL-BLOWN SUNDAY NIGHT KARAOKE. Can somebody please high five me?!
author: G. J.

description: An uncrowded Mission Irish dive bar with young white girls having a hip hop karaoke contest on a Saturday night . . . this clash of cultures was a stunning thing to behold.
author: Joe C.

description:
I had walked by this pub dozens of times, and on each occasion I thought it just a tiny bit out of place...c'mon an Irish pub in the heart of the Mission?!?! Had I just stepped through a worm-hole that spit me out in the Sunset?! 
Finally I had a great reason to step through the thresh-hold - co-workers enjoying a pint and some great live music. 
It was TINY...at least the front room was. We crowded around and happily swiveled  on our stools anytime anyone needed to get through the aisle that even Paris Hilton would have trouble squeezing through. (Fortunately she was not present...would have severely affected my review) 
The bartenders were friendly and attentive. 
I must qualify this review --- I DID NOT EAT. The past ratings seem to reflect the quality of the food...i am merely rating on booze-ability and the ability to spend some time there with a group of friends and have a few chuckles. Four stars for me...I would go back!
Lauren G. i will chuckle and not guffaw...should any obnoxious cacklers be near i will commence with a beat down!
author: Jessa B.

description: A wacked Irish bar deep in the Mission, full of latinos, has all the food and decorations an Irish bar should have in San Francisco, including bar flies from up the hill.  Food until ten, drinks till you drop.
author: Gil S.

description: The one good thing from dating that girl in the Mission for all of 2 weeks was coming here and getting tequila shots.  I never stopped by in the dark.  I never played pool.  We would stop by for a warm up shot and beer and be on our way.  It seemed cool enough.... for a Irish bar deep in the Mish.  I loved the people watching while at the bar and it was rightly priced.
author: Chard M.

description: I give this place 5 stars for the bitchin' trivia night that they do.  Excellent hard questions, good prizes and colorful crowd.  Definitely a must do for any trivia geeks.
author: Patrick B.

description:
last week i was in the mood to be keeled over with a gut-wrenching stomach ache caused by some of the worst food i have ever eaten in my entire life (and yeah, i've eaten chow mein in guatamala, skirt steak in vanuatu). good thing the napper tandy was open. they set me up with a standard so-easy-you-can't-possibly-screw-it-up breakfast combo of eggs and sausages with homefries. lo and behold, within thirty minutes i felt like i had swallowed a live cat...my entire body was jerky and wrecked from this foodish filth. not just me, but the 4 other folks who shared the same breakfast felt the exact same. ...a few days later, after significant warning, a friend ate there AGAIN...same story. he paid the price, oh, he paid the price.

this is a place that serves "french toast with fresh fruit" with three-week old refridgerator-rotted CANNED fruit. people. there's a frickin horn-a-plenty fresh fruit stand across the street! oh, i could go on and on. i have to say, tho, that i kind of repect their persistence, i mean, it's like failing grade school -- you have to really try to do that, to be that bad. and for that, i give them an A for effort . For, dear reader, they have succeeded in being number one in at least one category: the most digusting ass-food in the city.
author: Tad P.

description: Ok, I haven't had the food and most likely never will. This is great clean bar which is somehwat uncommen in the mission. The service is great (ok the bartnder may have bought a round or two). I work in the neighborhood so this is kinda a nice plain to unwind on a Friday afternoon.  They were kind enough to make my co-worker a blended  mango margarita (she had a big craving) even though they had to go find the blender and make sure it worked. I hear they have kick ass karaoke on a Saturday nite as well.
author: Catherine D.

description:
i like the randomness of this place. we went last night for fish and chips (Friday). the fish was more batter than meat, but the chips were good.  the randomness comes from the clientele- a bunch of old doods, some latinos, a lot of young hot irish guys with young hot irish accents, and us.  not a lot of ladies up in the joint. it seemed like the type of place you stop in after work and before going out (even though it was like 10pm-ish when we got there).  

There's an irish guy who i feel sure is a regular, who is the funniest thing ever. my friend and i never laughed so much in my life, and i'm sure if i go back, he'll be there again. so for that reason alone i give this place 4 stars for intertainment.
author: ms.kiki g.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE!! Found them on restaurant.com. Thought it would be a great place to go to with some friends up visiting for the weekend. The fish and chips and Shepherds pie are to die for. Service was great, considering there was only one person running the bar and serving. She did fantastic. Will definitely be back very soon.
author: Kathy W.

description: I walk past the NapTand every day, check out the brunch and dinner specials chalk board, and think "I wonder if that's any good." I figured I would put all my eggs in one basket and go for dinner AND trivia night on a random Wednesday night. I don't know what I expected but I was let down. Trivia didn't start until a good 30-45 minutes after they said it would, the booths were extremely uncomfortable to sit in, and the food was sub par. Someone described the fish and chips as fish doughnuts. Eww. I would give it only one star but the oktoberfest was decent. What can I say, I'm a sucker for beer...
author: Susan L.

description: Okay, so I don't really drink at this bar (seems kinda like a fishbowl full of televisions) but I do walk by quite often and I'm always amused at the bad spelling on their specials board outside. One time they actually had a special called "Festy Nachos". What the hell was that supposed to be?? Festy?? I've even seen Mango Moose Cake (mmmm, moose). One of these days I'm going to drop a dictionary at their door, but until then at least it gives me something to smile about on 24th street.
author: Stella O.

description: Had several rounds of blood mary's and the first couple were spicy and good. They went a little downhill towards the end, but still is a good spot to watch some sports and have a few drinks. As for the food, not sure why anyone would actually eat here, considering all the other options in the vacinity...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
i remember being out celebrating my friend's 25th birthday with the napper being the final stop on our vodka infused evening. us girls were far too faded to partake in trivia; and the boys were freakishly way too into it!! wanna know how done i was?! instead of participating in trivia, i decided the table made a much better pillow. sadly, so did the birthday girl. as i sat there arm folded on table and face buried in arm; i heard a trivia question through my Z catching. 

of the seven wonders of the world; which is the only one that still exists?

i instantly popped my head up and told the boys it was the pyramid of giza. the boys laughed at me and told me i was wrong and decided to go with the grand canyon. i gave a very polite "F*CK YOU" and put my head back down. moments later the answers were called out and.... dun dun dun...who was right?! YUP the drunk girl passed out on the table!!! to that i raised my head again, and said "DAMN it feels good to be a gangster" and put my head back down again.

the moral of this story is:
1) girls are always right
2) the napper not only makes great drinks, but is also has fun trivia nights
3) the napper ALSO makes a great resting place.
author: Kristin Y.

description:
the bar maids who work here are mad!  they're drinking with the patrons, and may be even drunker than them too.  

it's good fun at this bar.  it's the kind of bar where you keep knocking them down the hatch, and the next day you're trying to retrace the events of your previous binge session.
author: Sheri N.

description: I had never heard of this place until I went there last night for a friend's birthday party- karaoke style.  The bar is a bit cramped but I think that adds to the atomsphere and allows you to get to know your fellow bar-mates.  The bartenders were attentive and friendly and even though it was very crowded it wasn't too hard to get a drink.  When I am in this neighborhood again I would make a return trip.
author: Liz U.

description: Best fish and chips EVER!  It's definitely a local bar with local Irish peoples chillin on any given day.  It's a good spot.  I come here when I'm craving fish and chips or a nicely poured black velvet.  YUM!  The bartender is super nice and awesome in every way possible.  There's a front area where the bar is plus a back area with more booths, tables, and a pool table.  There's also a jukebox so I've been known to come here for happy hour, turned dance party, with the coworkers.  They also have trivia night, which I need to remember to partake in sometime soon!
author: Lynda N.

description: I was only there for 20 minutes, but any place that has a bar that big in a space that small deserves a starting point of 4 starts. Lots of stools, lots of TVs, nice peeps.
author: Annie T.

description:
I went to the Napper Tandy to: 

    A.) experience the DJ (a little birdy told me he was good)
    B.) Karaoke
    C.)Spend quality time w/ the boys
    and D.) get snockered

All in a short period of time because I turn into a pumpkin after 12! *gasp*   j/k... BART stops running at 12 and little ol' me would have no place to go after last call.   All that being said, I love Karaoke more than life itself.  So I'm one of those people who doesn't need to be drunk when I belt out Kelly Clarkson's - "A Moment Like This" to a crowded bar in the middle of SF, but it doesn't hurt.  :-) 
My friends & I took BART from Pleasanton. Arriving safe and sound in SF around 9:30, we took a short walk to an already pretty crowded establishment. When I first walked in I was like " wow, this place is tiny!! ".  The DJ greeted us warmly upon entry.  We made our way, shuffling, single file along the right side of the bar to the back room.  As we entered this new area we saw some friends sitting in one of 6 or so large wooden booths that sat 6 people each.  I would imagine that the space would be ideal to shoot a scene in Boon Dock Saints. Or just grab a pint on a cool afternoon in the city with a few friends. mmm sounds so cozy ~ ^,_,^ ~ At any rate... it was great while it lasted and the Karaoke was a blast. The crowd is so supportive and very warm. The drinks were average both in quality and cost. The bar tender was nice... Tall thin blonde lady with a nice smile. I would say it was worth the BART ticket out there, but I would have really liked to stay the whole night and crash at someones house in SF... Maybe next time. 

Over all a great place. :o)
I want to be there for quiz night... *sigh* Some day I guess - They list their weekly (or was it Monthly *ponders for a moment* )events on they're coasters and so I am curious... Sounds like fun.
author: Lynsey T.

description:
Exactly what you'd expect.  Down-home drinks, service, and decor.

For misguided "Sammy S.":  never got anything but stellar service there.  I guess not being a hipster helps in that regard.  Also: you don't order lime with a whiskey and coke.  Are you new to drinking?  And, you don't "excuse me, yoohoo" -anyone-, never mind the person pouring for you.  There's such a thing as the customer being flat-out wrong, rude, or in your case both.

The bartender I believe you refer to has *always* been pleasant to me and is pleasant to look at.

Plus, your raving personal attacks are sad.  Did you go in on your "red week," by chance, or just write your review during it?
author: Jimmy V.

description: holy shit this is ike the worst food i've ever had to pay for. seriously, I would rather have a "moons over my hammy" at Denny's than anything from this rotten kitchen. My frist try at the Napper I ordered a caesar salad-what i got was iceberg salad max (complete with little shredded carrots) and WISHBONE ITAILIAN DRESSING. that's right, wishbone Italian. That's right, on a Caesar. the second time I was there drinking and my friend insisted on eating-I warned her, tbut my attempt was futile. a quesadilla. literally the kind you make at home when you are wasted-two torillas grilled with shredded american in the middle. that's it. oh and a ramekin of sour cream. i watched another friend ruin his night by ordering pork chops-about a centimeter thick and dry as my mouth after a four foot bong rip. you have been warned...
author: Chaka K.

description:
So hey!  This is a goddamned Dive Bar.  Not a Michelin rated restaurant.  They have the best Effing Fish & Chips in San Francisco though the great ingredients in their burgrers could do w/ a bit more temperature to give a slight crusty-ness to the patties. 

That said, the crowd is usually great, the staff a hell of a lot of fun if a bit distracted at times, & the pints good & chilly.

Make sure to stop in on Saturday days when 'The Meanest...and Most Fun' Bartender in San Francisco is working.  The locals all seem to have an outrageous time giving her a load of Sh%#t while she dishes it right back!  They call her something like, 'The Lorn Beast', or 'Haggy'.  Note exactly politically correct, but what she doesn't seem to care.  People show up just for the abuse as it's apparently something of a weekend ritual amongst the regulars and a great bit of fun for the unsuspecting sod who wanders in.  The odd surburban droid might not get it unfortunately.  Then urbanites don't get them either.

The only real down side is that it is usually something of a Sausage Party.  Especially on the weekend days with the American Footbal crap.  That said, 'Cherry' (?) is the sweetest thing this side of Honolulu and everybody seems to be hot for the blonde one they call 'The Teacher'.
author: Neil S.

description:
I have been here only on Wednesdays. My experiences are limited to Wednesdays, so this review will be based on my Wednesday visits.

Why Wednesday, you ask? The Napper Tandy runs a little thing called A Pub Quiz. As such, they are heavily staffed by a large number of Irish folk who happen to be among the nicest pub workers in the world, albeit heavily understaffed. In addition to being patient and kind, they make tasty chicken fingers and finger-licking good chocolate martinis.

I wish I could say the same about pub quiz attendees. RAMPANT cheating. I don't want to see your iPhone pulled out, little fingers typing away on Blackberrys (Blackberries?!?). Just... don't. Is that too much to ask?
author: Tina V.

description: This bar has no idea what it wants to be. It's not really Irish, it's got bright Mexican colors and is filled with confused white people. Too schizophrenic.
author: Andrew L.

description: I've gotta say, I live very near to this bar and have only ventured in once or twice.  Bad Marina-style karaoke on the weekends spills out onto the sidewalk.  Last night, however, all I had in mind was a beer and a game of pool.  And Napper Tandy could not deliver.  The doorguy was literally passed out on his stool-and it was 8:00.  The bartender was MIA, then she was on the phone, then she was smoking.  On my 4th visit (still no beer) I let her know that the cue ball was stuck.  She tried to shoo me away; I had to beg for my beer.  And it was a crappy beer.  And she told me one price and charged me another.  Anyway, it's confirmed.  This place blows.  Thankfully, moved onto Bar Mission at 23rd and had an EXCELLENT experience.
author: rachel h.

description: I get it - it's a bar, not a restaurant.  I come here about once a week to watch Giants' games because it's on my way home from the BART station.  Bartenders are mildly friendly and the beer is beer (not a bad selection, but nothing prolific either).  The food however, is incredibly bland.  Had fish and chips last night ($12 I think) and didnt taste anything other than the tartar sauce I ended up having to use to make the fish have any flavor.  If they don't care about the food, that's fine, but i think the prices should reflect that.  Don't mind coming here for a beer while watching the game, but won't miss the place when I move to the Richmond next month.
author: Dareyn S.

description: $5 breakfast on Saturday and cheap mimosas - pretty good bargain for SF, even if the portions aren't that big.
author: Amanda L.

description: Good atmosphere but the wings and fish where sub par.  The fries on the other hand are fan f**king-tastic.  The service was good and I'll def give their burger a try next time I stop in.
author: Jason S.

description: Some people like to drink so they go to a place like The Napper Tandy and have half a dozen Pilsner Urquells for $4 a piece and then go off happy to have a bite to eat somewhere else and dream  a little dream once they get home to their beddy-byes.  The end.
author: Kasey K.

description: Shut up you noisy m*****f*****s!!! I live on the next block up and invariably on any weekend-night there is always some drunken pack of pale, blotchy skinned girls smoking on each other and screaming on the corner in front of it. And just so you guys out there don't get any big ideas: they're usually fat and stupid! Yeah, I said it, you wanna brawl?!  I'm gonna get a paint gun.
