I walk by this place in the morning on my way to bart and it usually smells like Pine-Sol and throwup. It boggles the mind that anyone would eat there. Luckily alcohol kills bacteria.
author: Lauren G.

description: I mainly visit the NT on Thursday poker nights.  The pot pie is really good with a decent salad to boot.  And they have good meatloaf too.  How do I know about the meatloaf if the potpie is so good?  Well, they gave me a meatloaf dinner free one night after accidentally making me wait FOREVER, for some potpie to go.  Wouldn't take my cash for the potpie either and set me up with a free Harp whilst I waited.  Very creamy mashed taters too.
author: Joe N.

description: A real Irish bar in the Mission! without the 'tude. Highly recommend the Guiness stew which is amazing. Giant fish and chips. And if you're a fan of Irish soda bread, this place will remind you of your mum or your friends mum. The atmosphere is on local bar/divey side but it definately has it's charm.
author: kevin k.

description:
Not really sure what to expect as reviews seem mixed (except for the guy/girl who lives down the street...quit your b**thin, if it bothers you so much move and stop hating.) but me and my mates had an excellent time. The female bartender mixed a mean fast drink and really new her stuff as we drank our way through a multitude of cocktails. I also like the fact that they serve Magners my favorite home town drink. We had such a good time at the bar that night that we braved a pick me up the next morning and we where not disappointed. The irish bfast was just the job with real galtee meats and heinz beans hmm hmmm. Cant wait to go back. Glad the kitchen has sorted things out. Great atmosphere and wonderful service both times. Thumbs way up :) 
PS I did not see any fat blotchy women only young and middle aged people having FUN and interacting with each other.
author: Vanessa D.

description:
i have no real desire to come here at night, but have recently become rather fond of stopping by in the afternoon for a bloody mary or two. 

their bloody maries are tasty, not the best, but certainly worth dropping a five buck bill from time to time. i have yet to try their food, but i am determined to try their fish and chips one of these days. 

there has always been questionable music involved in my visits... playing the killers one notch over acceptable happy hour volume, making it rather difficult to hear what your company is saying, is a bit of a bummer.

the bartenders have always been friendly ladies, though, and there is just something about the small, highly intoxicated, early afternoon crowd that appeals to me.
author: Kayla K.

description: The usual after work stopover on the way home...great corned beef and cabbage, good beers, and friendly bartenders make the Napper a vital part of my daily diet. With the pool table in back you've always got something to make an ass of yourself at after too many drinks!
author: Craig E.

description: Great hole in the wall pub to have a drink without too many lingering readers, web surfers, people discussing the third or fourth degree they are working on (Momi Toby's, I am looking at you!).
author: Ben S.

description: Went here for the 1st last night with a group of friends. The drinks were well made and priced even better. We ended up ordering several rounds of garlic fries along with some fish & chips which was good but could have used some more flavoring. The bartender was attentive and quick with the drinks. Bathrooms were surprisingly clean which is a big plus.
author: Alfredo N.

description:
i like the set up of this bar. everyone sits around the bar, like circle time in kindergarten. 
my favorite thing:  the bar tenders don't give you death eyes if you ask for a bloody mary.
the bar tenders are nice and cute also.
check it out.
author: ellen m.

description: You ordered a quesadilla at an Irish bar and you're surprised it's not good??...Quiet enough at Thursday at 9 for a group of 8 to sit together, no problem. It got slightly busier as the night went on, but not much. Fine neighborhood place for a pint.
author: Amy E.

description:
the drinks are very good and very cheap, and also come very fast

the karaoke competition is zagat-rated as one of the most intense in the world next to that of american idol

parking here is surprisingly easy, and if you don't feel like hanging around, the neighborhood has a lot to offer
author: Charles C.

description:
as a dc transplant, i've been fiending for a place to watch 'skins games. and this has quickly become my favorite place, because come sunday, they've always got my game on by the time i arrive. also, there's a crowd of fellow dc transplants who gather there to watch them, meaning there's always someone to give a high-five when clinton portis catches a beautiful throw from jason campbell and skips into the inzone like it ain't no thang. 

this is not a perfect bar, but it's way better than your usual dive. and it's not a gourmet restaurant. but their food is way, way better than most bar food, and the person who said they have AMAZING fries--that person is entirely correct. 

and yes, the bartenders are actually irish. and they have a back room with a larger screen (just in case the 6 or so TVs in the front bar area weren't enough for ya) as well as a pool table and some booths. and they have decent vegetarian brunch options (veggie sandwich, tofu scramble, omelettes, banana-walnut pancakes, etc.), which makes football sundays fun for both me and my girl.
author: Marla W.

description: What more can I say, this is a great happening bar in the heart of the buzzing Mission district. Just a mere stones throw away from bart you can get fed, hammered, watch some ball, play some pool and then fall the few steps to bart. and home! brilliant !! The bar is fairly big plenty of light if you wanted to go in for a midday read which is why I went in in the first place but I came back to explore after I had a swift look at their menu which was presented to me by an Irish bartendress with a cheerful smile who asked how my day was before she asked what I would  like to drink. Its a big menu they do everything from hamburgers and Irish breakfasts to Quesadillas and pulled pork sandwiches the food is moderately priced but I dont mind paying if its worth it. They also have lots of beers on tap and I noticed three different bottles of tequila (which I hate but I guess I am in the Mission) There is a pool table in the back of the bar which always seems to be accepting quarters and the regulars do be lining up to take on the table champ. All in all good food, good people, great Craic
author: daire l.

description: So I went here for the trivia night a while back and was underwhelmed.  The trivia was one of the company written ones which instantly decreases my interest.  Given the division of the Tandy into several rooms, I think we only saw one of the other teams there.  Trivia also started late and was rather slow.  Most annoyingly, the prize was 30 "tandyBucks" which means my team will have to go back there at some point to use them.  Beer selection was decent, did not have food so I cannot comment on it.  The only thing I can say positive about the trivia is that the competition was very weak.
author: Alured P.

description: An Irish pub with a pool table, pitchers of beer, food, karaoke, and trivia nights.  What more could you ask for?  I like this little joint, I pop in every now and then for a beer and a snack.  They also serve breakfast on Friday, Saturday and Sunday.  Not the best food I've ever had but for the place and the price it's not a bad deal.  The bartenders are cool and on certain days they will play your iPod, which can be a good thing if you're You, but bad if you're stuck listening to someone else's crappy music.
author: P D.

description: I come here everytime i visit the city. Whether it's for a nice quiet meal with some friends  on a Tuesday where the bottles of wine are half price or when it's at it's liveliest friday/saturday night. My friends and i have a blast everytime we go-it seems like everyone knows everyone and they're not afraid to have fun.  The locals make you feel welcome and i can't help but  appreciate the authenticity of  the vibe thats created in the bar  by having a little Irish, Iatin, Amercan fusion of people.  Great pub grub-tough break for those who were disappointed cause the foods been delicious everytime i've been there. Myself and my girlfriends were there last Friday night-we were only supposed to go for one before we went to the yuppie red room. We never made it down town that night. Check this place out-Good times all around
author: Nicole T.

description: Good  food and great people in this bar which make It is a must.  It is a  Irish Pub with plenty of Irish people, not only the bartenders but also clientle.
author: Sean R.

description: Napper Tandy is the bar I head to when I need a drink and some grub after a taxing day at work. It always satifies. Usually Lisa seems to be working  but all the staff are great. Lorna was working a recent Thursday and was a hoot. I say to all the haters go to a different bar.
author: Ralph R.

description: Minus 4 stars for being a fake Irish pub.  What self -respecting Irish pub has no Chef Sauce or HP Brown sauce to serve with their full fry (Irish breakfast)?  The surly woman in charge says they have A-1 as if it's inter-changeable or a remotely close substitute.  Geez.  Roxie's Market in the sunset has cases of both sauces readily available for them to get some Irish street cred, but you can tell they just don't care.  Very negative vibe here.  Super sweet lady bartender Taylor tried to make up for your woman's surly-ness but it was outwieghed by tons.
author: Matt W.

description:
i love this bar. here we go:
-chill bartenders
-funny patrons
-chill atmosphere
-music cool depending on who is feeding the juke box
-BEST F*IN HOT WINGS IN THE MISSION, SERIOUSLY! 
reminds of something i would get on the eastcoast.
-STRONG DRINKS!
-good prices, 2 for 1 margaritas thursdays.
author: Michelle M.

description: fun bar with snarky fun waitresses, but a bathroom that stinks to high heaven.  within walking distance to the house, so we will definitely be back!
author: Jennifer L.

description: my friend and i wanted to catch some first round ncaa tournament action AND eat dinner so he suggested the napper tandy for its better than average bar food and he wasn't lying. we shared an order of potato skins, which were average. however, his shephard's pie and my fish and chips were surprisingly good. also worth mentioning were the numerous people who came in and picked up take-out orders. how many times do you witness that at a bar? next time there's a sporting event you wanna watch and you're lookin for a low-key atmosphere, one that your regular sports bar can't offer, and some decent grub, try this place.
author: Kevin C.

description: great neighborhood bar with a good to great kitchen, depending on your expectations.  if you think "pub food," you'll be happy.  fish and chips are lovely, as is the irish breakfast.  the bar gals are wonderful and the patron mix is always a hoot.  i want to add that i was there also during Carnaval and was impressed at how coolly and efficiently the gals handled the overflowing crowd.  we were amazed they even bothered opening the kitchen, but they did, and the food was as good as usual.
author: Kathryn S.

description: when i came in here last night a dude was singing the real slim shady on karaoke. i started to sing along and i knew the lyrics better than he did, too. then some really bad ballads came on and i had to have a couple of drinks just to stand it. unfortunately, i didn't have enough liquid courage to belt out a few myself. maybe next time. maybe i'll even get to use that fake guitar they have...
author: Oleya P.

description: ok, so this place is across from my new apartment in the mission, and while it seemed a little scary at first, they in fact have a good selection of beer on tap and damn good food.  what got me in?  the monday night fish & chips!  and they are really bloody good!  so good that my belly and innards were all messed up the next day from gobbling down four huge oily fillets.  they also got damn good burgers, jimo says that it's the best burger he's had so far in san francisco.  i'd say it's in the top 3, for sure.  anyway, aside from being a bit sporty and bro-ish, this is a cool spot.
author: eric i.

description: First time at this place last Saturday morning.  Wandered in alone off the street  looking for some breakfast.  I seemed to be the only non-regular but everyone was friendly & I had a great time.  The bartender was super entertaining & sweet - she did a smash up job managing all the customers bellowing at her for more booze, and kept my coffee cup full.
author: Anna V.

description: lorna! need i say more?
author: Jenny J.

description: Took a trip into The Napper Tandy last night after passing it on the bus for months.  Being Irish, I'm more than a little skeptical about Irish bars in the U.S. and nothing pushes my snob buttons more than a badly poured pint of the black stuff.  But, this is where my date wanted to meet & I decided to roll with it.  I was not disappointed.  This bar has buckets of personality, from the friendly regular crowd, the occasional amorous elderly gentlemen, to the constant hum of tvs broadcasting sport from everywhere else in the world.    I have to give extra-special props to the bartender - the lovely Lorna.  She was super friendly, efficient, managed to politely (but effectively) shoo away a demented old man who was sabotaging my date AND she complimented my perfume, so she has extremely good taste to boot! If you are looking for a bar in S.F. with some honest-to-goodness  real Irish flavor, go here.  If you are looking for Disney Irish, take  your sorry ass to the Marina and leave this Mission gem to those who can appreciate it.
author: Ciara M.

description: This is a great  place!!! Ive had some fun nights here in my life, which END UP turning into crazy nights. Maybe I'm biased  - I love pubs. They are truly the greatest social environments on Earth. Now if you could do a pub orgy, anyway, the wait staff are comprised of pretty ladies who'll happily pour you a beer, just don't get cheap on the tip, otherwise they unleash the beast on you. He sits happily downstairs in the basement, and is fed Guinness and fish and chips, but is most happy when he is called to the task of having to "escort" someone out of there. So, take my word, don't disrespect the ladies. There is ALWAYS sports playing, and it is a very intimate setting to watch sports of all kinds particularly World Cup games, though they show futbol(soccer) year round. Sometimes you don't need to do Jilians to watch sports. The food is also great, really, but the in intimacy, and great service from all the girls there is what keeps people going. Oh and then there's also Aiden. Oh and karaoke on Saturday night brings in a dedicated group of singers with beautiful voices. This karaoke rocks because everyone is havin fun with it, no Minty pressure.
author: Maui G.

description: great food, good selection of beers on tap and a great staff.  check it out
author: Ausewaldoe J.

description: a great place to hang out on an off day...was actually a lot less grubby than I expected and all the servers were actually Irish!  points for "authenticity".  Plus they have a fun pub quiz night on wednesdays that isn't so ridiculously hard that you sit there feeling like an idiot all night, but hard enough where you're using a few brain cells.
author: jozilla w.

description: How to start! Firstly i'd like to say that some of the earlier reviews here are waaaaaay off! I've only recently discovered The Napper and i cannot find one bad thing to say about the place, honestly! The food is just delicious, have tried the fish n chips, chicken tenders, the breakfast, (real rashers, sausages & puddin!) a few other things but can't remember all the names, saw alot of food being served to other people and they looked yum too, every other customer i've seen in there seems pretty happy and full with it too as all plates are empty going back to the kitchen! Portions are massive, definitely worth the price. The place is very clean, staff are great craic, cocktails are yum. They have some good deals going on a daily basis, ie Mon is all you can eat Fish n chips, tues half price bottles wine.  They do specials on some of the cocktails too i think.  Will definitely be going back for the cure breakfast or just for a good session! Any body who says different must be in the wrong bar!
author: Maureen D.
